0.title: Sensodyne asked to discontinue misleading ads, fined ₹10 lakh
0.article_body: The Central Consumer Protection Authority has imposed a ₹10 lakh fine on Sensodyne while ordering it to discontinue certain misleading advertisements within seven days. Ads that claimed Sensodyne as 'Recommended by dentists worldwide' and 'World's No.1 sensitivity toothpaste' have been ordered to be stopped. Earlier, Sensodyne was asked to stop ads that showed endorsement by foreign dentists.

1.title: Hyd Police conducts drive against vehicles using MLA stickers illegally
1.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police started a special drive on Saturday against vehicles using MLA, police and press stickers illegally. The drive, which is also against vehicles using tinted glass and improper number plates, was conducted after an SUV with an MLA sticker hit street vendors and killed an infant in Jubilee Hills. Officers imposed challans against vehicles violating CMV rules, 1989.

2.title: Delhi man drugs & rapes woman after proposing marriage, booked
2.article_body: Police have booked a Delhi man for allegedly raping a 35-year-old woman after proposing marriage and threatening to circulate her private pictures on the internet. According to the woman, the accused raped her after serving her a sedative-laced drink in Mohali. Refusing to marry her, he threatened to circulate pictures of the act if she filed a case against him.

3.title: New Zealand reports 20,907 new community COVID-19 cases, 15 deaths
3.article_body: New Zealand Ministry of Health on Tuesday reported 20,907 new community cases of COVID-19. The officials added that Auckland logged the highest number of cases with 4,291 infections followed by Canterbury with 3,488 cases. The ministry also said the country reported 15 deaths on the same day taking the total number of publicly reported deaths to 199.

4.title: 2 arrested for robbing man, female friend of ₹76,000 in Pune's Pashan
4.article_body: Two people have been arrested in Pune in connection with the Pashan Hill robbery case, wherein a man and his female friend were allegedly beaten up and forced to make digital transfers worth ₹76,000. Police said the search for the third suspect is currently on. The victims were sitting on a rock on Pashan Hill when the accused approached them.

5.title: Hyd Police shares post on need of Anti-Drug Committees with helpline
5.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Monday shared a post about the need for Anti-Drug Abuse Committees. The force, while using the hashtags 'SayNoToDrugs' and 'AntiDrugCampaign' on Twitter, wrote, "For...better future for...students, every institution should have...policy to be a drug-free campus and the first step...is to set up 'Anti-Drug Abuse Committees'." It also shared a number for help and reporting cases.

6.title: Celina shares old pic with Priyanka, says 'seems we were forced to pose like dolls'
6.article_body: Actress Celina Jaitly has shared a picture from an old photoshoot with actress Priyanka Chopra on Twitter. "I have always wondered what [Priyanka] and I were thinking when we did this shoot back then lol...It seems we were either very cold or superhero action figures forced to pose like dolls," she wrote.

7.title: UN panel of nations holds talks to reduce carbon emissions
7.article_body: Nearly 200 members of UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) gathered virtually in London to discuss plans to reduce carbon emissions. As per IPCC, the third and final report stresses on ways in which key sectors such as energy, transport, industry and agriculture can cut emissions. The former two reports discussed the causes and impacts of climate crisis.

8.title: New Delhi remained world's most polluted capital in 2021: Report
8.article_body: A report by IQAir, a Swiss air quality technology company, stated that India's overall pollution levels worsened in 2021 and New Delhi remained the world's most polluted capital. As per the report, not a single country managed to meet the World Health Organization standards last year. The report surveyed pollution data from 6,475 cities.

9.title: Biker hits elderly man waiting for bus, Cyberabad police shares video
9.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Tuesday posted a video of a road accident in the city. The video shows an elderly man, who was waiting for a bus, being hit by a speeding bike. According to the police, the victim sustained severe injuries in the accident. "Don't let your speed suffer innocents. Drive Responsible. Be safe," the police captioned the video.

10.title: 'Pradeep not alone in struggling', says man to Vinod Kapri; filmmaker shares texts
10.article_body: After his video showing 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra running at night to train for Army exam, filmmaker Vinod Kapri shared texts from Facebook users who reached out to him for help in getting jobs. "Pradeep isn't the only one...There are others struggling even more," said one user. He said he'd done MA, BEd and is now working in a stone factory.

11.title: Nephew said bua is worth something: Shabana Azmi on 'Halo' casting
11.article_body: Veteran actress Shabana Azmi has revealed that her brother Baba Azmi's 15-year-old son Viraj said that bua (aunt) is really worth something after she was cast in American series 'Halo'. "My nephew...had never given me time of day before that," the actress added. Shabana will portray the head of the Office of Naval Intelligence Admiral Margaret Parangosky in the series.

12.title: Yemen's Houthis target Saudi oil site, satellite photos surface
12.article_body: Satellite photos from Planet Labs PBC, a US public Earth imaging company, on Tuesday showed Yemen's Houthi rebels targeted the Saudi Aramco oil storage tank situated in Jeddah on Sunday. According to the firm, missile attack by the Iran-backed rebel group also struck a petrochemicals complex in Yanbu and North Jeddah Bulk Plant, which stores diesel, gasoline and jet fuel.

13.title: Strongly committed to relations with Taiwan: Marshall Islands Prez
13.article_body: Marshall Islands President David Kabua has said that the country is "strongly committed" to its ties with Taiwan, adding that he's confident of their "unique alliance". "It's time for Taiwan to take its rightful place as an equal member of...family of nations," Kabua added. The Marshall Islands is one of the 14 countries that maintain formal diplomatic ties with Taiwan.

14.title: Russians fight each other for sugar in supermarket; video goes viral
14.article_body: A viral video on social media showed Russians fighting with each other for sugar at a supermarket amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. It showed a staffer pushing a trolley full of sugar bags in the supermarket, prompting shoppers to fight each other to get hold of some. Since the end of last week, sugar prices have risen by 12.8% in Russia.

15.title: 90 lakh children to be vaccinated against polio in Africa: UNICEF
15.article_body: More than 90 lakh children will be vaccinated against polio in four African countries in the inoculation drive launched this week, according to UNICEF. The drive was launched after Malawi reported a polio outbreak last month. The vaccination drive is currently underway in Malawi and it will be expanded to neighbouring Mozambique, Tanzania and Zambia on Thursday, UNICEF said.

16.title: Putin is clearly considering using biological and chemical weapons: Biden
16.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Monday dismissed Russian President Vladimir Putin's accusations that Ukraine has biological and chemical weapons, adding, "That's a clear sign he's considering using both of those." Biden said Putin is setting up "false flags" and asserting that America has biological and chemical weapons in Europe. He said this accusation was also "simply not true".

17.title: Indians can visit Mansarovar via Uttarakhand by Dec 2023: Gadkari
17.article_body: Minister of Road Transport & Highways Nitin Gadkari said on Tuesday that Indians will be able to visit Kailash Mansarovar via Uttarakhand by December 2023, without going through Nepal or China. A road was being carved out from Pithoragarh to take a person straight to Mansarovar. This road would provide a smooth ride unlike the present treacherous trek, he said.

18.title: Bappi Lahiri wanted Ranveer Singh to play him in biopic: Bappa
18.article_body: Bappi Lahiri's son Bappa Lahiri has said his father wanted Ranveer Singh to play the late singer in his biopic. "This was three-four years back, we were having a couple of meetings with producers and dad loved Ranveer Singh," he stated. Bappa added that Ranveer hasn't been approached yet as the writing and pre-production work for the biopic is unfinished.

19.title: We have got a script ready: John Abraham on 'Attack' sequel
19.article_body: Actor John Abraham, speaking about his upcoming film 'Attack', has said that the script of the film's sequel is ready. "We signed on for 'Attack 2' with Jayantilal Gada (producer) even before the release of 'Attack'," he added. John further said, "When you see our film, you will realise that our film needs to take the story forward."

20.title: No evidence my fist blow killed the man: Sidhu to SC in 1988 road rage case
20.article_body: Navjot Singh Sidhu has told Supreme Court there is no conclusive evidence to show his single fist blow led to the death of a 65-year-old man in a 1988 road rage case. He said it while opposing a plea by the victim's family to punish him for a more serious offence like culpable homicide or murder, than for causing hurt.

21.title: I'll never do daily soaps again, almost quit acting: Deepika
21.article_body: Actress Deepika Singh Goyal, known for portraying Sandhya in 'Diya Aur Baati Hum', has said that she will never do a daily soap again. The actress added that the lifestyle caused health problems for her which almost made her quit acting. She further said that she is able to bear her own expenses due to social media.

22.title: Paris 2024 Olympics organisers plan to sell record 13.4 million tickets
22.article_body: Organisers of the Paris 2024 Olympics are claiming to put 13.4 million tickets available for the event, which include 3.4 million for Paralympic Games, the chief of the organising committee Tony Estanguet said. He added that the cheapest tickets for the Olympics and Paralympics will cost €24 and €15 respectively. "Ticketing programme represents one-third of our revenue," he said.

23.title: Don't know why people think I've stopped working in B'wood: Rituparna
23.article_body: Actress Rituparna Sengupta has said that she never stopped working in Bollywood. "I don't know why people think I have stopped working and call every Hindi project of mine as my 'comeback' project," she added. Rituparna stated that she might have worked more in the Bengali film industry at times, however, added the Hindi film industry has always been there.

24.title: Had sent Aamir Khan a photograph of myself with love letter: Shefali
24.article_body: When asked who was the person on whom she had a crush on during her college days, actress Shefali Shah named actor Aamir Khan. Shefali revealed she sent a photograph of herself with a love letter to the actor. "In the photograph, I was standing there (gesturing far away) but it was looking...nice because it was blurred," she added.

25.title: Congress unaffected by victory or defeat: Mallikarjun Kharge
25.article_body: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has said that Congress is "not affected by victory or defeat" in elections. Kharge said, in context to the party's debacle in the recent five state assembly elections, that the Congress "doesn't engage in vote-bank politics and also, doesn't abandon its core ideology". He further accused BJP of being a "dictatorial party".

26.title: 45-yr-old man dies as DTC bus runs over him in Delhi; bus driver held
26.article_body: A 45-year-old man was killed after a low-floor non-AC Delhi Transport Corporation bus hit his motorcycle and ran over him as he fell off his bike, said police. The incident occurred on Delhi's Outer Ring Road flyover near Peeragarhi on Saturday. The driver tried to flee from the spot after the accident, but a police constable chased and nabbed him.

27.title: Men throw toilet cleaner on B'luru woman from her house's window; held
27.article_body: A civil contractor and his associate were detained for allegedly throwing toilet cleaner on a woman through the open window of her house in Bengaluru, a report stated. The contractor had reportedly given the woman around ₹3,00,000 to lease a single-bedroom house. However, as he felt that she was ignoring her, he allegedly harmed her. The victim sustained burn injuries.

28.title: It's amazing that I've a partner who is equally creative: Santanu on Shruti
28.article_body: Artist Santanu Hazarika said he feels blessed to share a special bond with his girlfriend, actor Shruti Haasan. He added, "It is amazing that I have a partner who is equally creative and provocative in her own domain. Every day, I come up with so many different ideas, thoughts and perspectives." "The pandemic and lockdown...made us more patient," he said.

29.title: Over 3,000 people to get offers in 'Job Mela' organised by Hyd Police
29.article_body: More than 3,000 people will get offers in the 'Job Mela' organised by the West Zone of the Hyderabad City Police on March 26. Around 30 companies, including ICICI Bank, Arena Animation and PVR Cinemas, are participating in the event, which will take place at Hyderabad's Sri Kotla Vijaya Bhaskar Reddy Stadium. Reportedly, the vacancies are open to all genders.

30.title: People are quite shameless: Vidya Balan on roles being offered to her
30.article_body: Discussing the kind of roles that are offered to her, actress Vidya Balan said, "People are quite shameless and will come...with everything. Sometimes I go, 'Brother...will you give me the hero's role'." "I am not saying that I will only play the most important role but I need something that I can dig my teeth into," added Vidya.

31.title: People recognise me because of Baahubali, it was a game-changer Prabhas
31.article_body: When asked about his game-changing project, actor Prabhas said it's 'Baahubali'. "It is definitely 'Baahubali' for my life. It was super exciting for me. Anywhere I come (people recognise me)," he added. "All this happened because of [that film]. So, everything in my life is 'Baahubali' even if I get lucky and bigger but it's all that film," he said.

32.title: So inspirational, world must know: Devgn on true stories like 'The Kashmir...'
32.article_body: Talking about movies based on true stories like film 'The Kashmir Files', Ajay Devgn said, "When you hear stories, some of them are so inspirational. Sometimes the truth is so amazing that you can't write fiction like that." "When you hear a true story, you feel that the world must know about it," added Devgn.

33.title: It was tricky as my name was last among the pacers: Unadkat on mega auction
33.article_body: Fast bowler Jaydev Unadkat said he is really excited for IPL 2022 having joined five-time champions Mumbai Indians, who have "ruled" the IPL over the years. "When [the mega auction] started, it was nervy because my name was last [among the pacers]. It was tricky," added Unadkat. Unadkat was bought by MI for ₹1.3 crore in the mega auction.

34.title: It's not right to lie knowingly: Apple's Wozniak on Theranos Founder
34.article_body: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak while discussing blood-testing startup Theranos' Founder Elizabeth Holmes said, "It's not right to deceive and lie knowingly." "If she was motivated too much by money, then she's not my type," he added. Holmes was found guilty of three counts of fraud and one count of conspiring to defraud private investors.

35.title: Saluting all Madam Sirs: Rasika on 'Delhi Crime' completing 3 years
35.article_body: Rasika Dugal shared a post as her show Delhi Crime completed 3 years. Taking to Instagram, Rasika shared the montage of the character she essayed in the show and wrote, "This one is close to my heart. I miss your sensitivity Delhi Crime team and I miss your idealism, Neeti Singh. Here's saluting all Madam Sirs!"

36.title: Cried a lot the 2nd time, couldn't see the 3rd time: Kapil Dev on watching '83'
36.article_body: Kapil Dev said the movie '83' did not impact him a lot the first time but he cried a lot while watching the second time, adding that he left the third time as he couldn't watch it. "I couldn't believe our lives have been transpired so beautifully," stated Dev. Ranveer Singh portrayed India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain in the film.

37.title: Fresh notices sent to Sonia, Rahul, Kapil Mishra in Delhi riots case
37.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday issued fresh notices to several political leaders, including Congress' Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi and BJP's Kapil Mishra, while hearing pleas in connection with Delhi riots cases and alleged hate speeches by political leaders. The court sought a response from them on the application which freshly impleaded them as a party in the case.

38.title: It was a wonderful experience: Kapil on visiting Konark Sun Temple in Odisha
38.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma is in Odisha, where he is shooting for Nandita Das' directorial. The comedian-actor recently visited the Sri Jagannatha Temple in Puri and the Konark Sun Temple, which is 35 kilometres from Puri. Taking to Instagram, he shared his picture from the Konark Sun Temple, and wrote, "It was a wonderful experience visiting #Konark #suntemple...#odisha."

39.title: 15,300 Russian soldiers killed, 509 enemy tanks destroyed: Ukraine
39.article_body: Ukraine's military on Tuesday claimed that it has killed about 15,300 Russian soldiers since the Russian invasion began on February 24. The military also claimed that it has destroyed 509 Russian tanks and over 222 aircraft, including 123 helicopters. It further estimated that its troops have destroyed 1,556 armoured personnel carriers, 252 artillery systems and 80 multiple launch rocket systems.

40.title: Whenever I scored runs, someone else scored better: Karun Nair
40.article_body: Karun Nair, who'll feature for RR in IPL 2022 after being bought for ₹1.4 crore, has said people don't see him as a T20 specialist because he has been asked to play different roles over the years. He also added, "Whenever I scored runs, someone else scored better in the same match." Karun didn't play a single game last season.

41.title: UP STF rescued birds of endangered species, two held
41.article_body: On World Sparrow Day, the Special Task Force of UP Police on Sunday rescued endangered species of birds, 206 parrots and 18 munia, in a joint operation in Lucknow, senior police officials said. Two people who were involved in the sale and purchase of these endangered species were arrested and booked under different sections of the Wild Life Conservation Act-1972.

42.title: Ajay Devgn always wanted to be a director, not an actor: Rohit Shetty
42.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty said actor Ajay Devgn "always wanted" to be a director and not an actor, adding that his technical knowledge as a director is "unparalleled". Ajay is the director, one of the producers and will star as well in the upcoming film 'Runway 34'. "Ajay...goes all out [as a producer] if he believes in the script," stated Rohit.

43.title: They play on a lot of easy pitches at home: Rashid Latif on Kohli, Smith
43.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli and Steve Smith, ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said they play on a lot of "easy" pitches at home, with Smith yet to score a century in Australia's Test series against Pakistan. Kohli last scored an international hundred in November 2019. "Once Smith starts scoring runs, fielders are placed [accordingly] and he gets bogged down," added Latif.

44.title: Infiltration across LoC declined significantly since 2018: Centre
44.article_body: The Centre informed Lok Sabha on Tuesday that infiltration across Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir has decreased significantly since 2018. Around 366 infiltrations were reported between 2018 and 2021, MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said. "As per inputs, significant number of suspected terrorists remain present at various launchpads in Pakistan or Pakistan occupied Kashmir," he added.

45.title: Make Mumbai mosquito-proof: BMC Commissioner to officials
45.article_body: Mumbai Municipal Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal on Monday directed municipal officials and other agencies to make Mumbai mosquito-proof by April 30. He asked officials to mosquito-proof water tanks, dispose waste and scrap materials, fumigate mosquito-breeding areas and share photos of the completed work with him. Mumbai reported 5,032 cases of malaria between January and December 12, 2021.

46.title: Harry Potter actress Bonnie Wright marries Andrew Lococo; pics surface
46.article_body: Bonnie Wright, best known for playing Ginny Weasley in the Harry Potter, has gotten married to boyfriend Andrew Lococo. The wedding took place at Andrew's farm, with Bonnie's friend solemnising the marriage. "Yesterday was the best day of my life thanks to my husband," Bonnie wrote on Instagram while announcing the wedding.

47.title: Glenn Maxwell, wife Vini Raman share pictures from their haldi ceremony
47.article_body: Australian cricketer Glenn Maxwell and his wife Vini Raman took to Instagram to share pictures from their haldi ceremony. "A little glimpse into our intimate Nalangu/Haldi ceremony," wrote Vini. In another post, she wrote, "What's that saying...Happy wife happy life." The couple, who got married as per Christian rituals on March 18, will marry with Tamil-Brahmin customs on March 27.

48.title: State of women's sports is very fragile: World Athletics Prez Coe
48.article_body: World Athletics President Sebastian Coe has said that the state of women's sports is "very fragile" and federations need to have the right rules for transgender female athletes. Coe's comments came days after US swimmer Lia Thomas became the first transgender NCAA champion in Division-1 history. "These are sensitive issues...societal issues — they go way...beyond sport," he said.

49.title: Dhoni no longer the same finisher that he was: Reetinder Sodhi
49.article_body: Former India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi has said that MS Dhoni is "no longer the same finisher that he was known to be a few years back". Speaking on a TV show, Sodhi advocated the point of Dhoni batting higher in the order, saying, "If he takes his time, comes in the 10th over, he can hit the lusty blows later."

50.title: Bitcoin price rises to $43,337 to highest level in three weeks
50.article_body: The price of the world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin rose as much as 5.6% to $43,337 on Tuesday, its highest since March 3. Ether, the second-largest cryptocurrency by market value, climbed as much as 5.4% to its highest since February 17. Bitcoin has added over 26% since its intra-day low of $34,324 on February 24 when Russia invaded Ukraine.

51.title: Panel recommends U-turn, cycle track at Hero Honda Chowk in Gurugram
51.article_body: The district administration-formed committee has recommended the construction of a cycle track and a U-turn at the Hero Honda Chowk (HHC) in Gurugram. The recommendations have been made to prevent driving on the road's wrong side and to make Delhi-Gurgaon Expressway more accessible, SDM (Gurugram) said. The committee had members from the district administration, police and NGOs.

52.title: ACB recovers 5kg gold, 15kg silver from businessman's house in B'luru
52.article_body: Anti Corruption Bureau on Tuesday recovered nearly 5 kg gold, 15 kg silver and 61.9 grams of diamonds from a businessman's house in Bengaluru, ANI reported. This comes after ACB conducted raids at residences of nine middlemen/agents suspected of influencing government officials in Bengaluru. They're suspected of being involved in malpractices in activities of the Bangalore Development Authority.

53.title: Andhra Pradesh Assembly Speaker suspends 4 TDP members
53.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly Speaker Thammineni Seetharam on Tuesday suspended four Telugu Desam Party (TDP) members from all sessions of the Assembly. This comes after the TDP members chanted slogans at the podium, demanding an inquiry into a liquor brand and a judicial inquiry into the Jangareddygudem incident. Their suspension will continue till the end of the current session.

54.title: Madhuri Dixit rents new house in Mumbai for ₹12.5 lakh per month
54.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit and her husband Dr Shriram Nene have rented a new house in Mumbai. Located on the 29th floor of a high-rise building, the couple has taken the house on lease and the rent is ₹12.5 lakh per month. Located in Worli, the house has a carpet area of 5,500 square feet and a view of the city.

55.title: Most ill-timed tweet ever: Actor Adil after criticism over his tweet on 'The Kashmir...'
55.article_body: After being criticised over his 'Truth must be spoken tenderly' tweet on 'The Kashmir Files', actor Adil Hussain tweeted, "My tweet was a general comment about my idea of Art. And I stand by it." He added, "I was flummoxed by most of the reactions to tweet in question...This tweet of mine is probably the most ill-timed tweet ever."

56.title: Champions are made like this: Harbhajan on 19-yr-old seen running at night in viral clip
56.article_body: Reacting to the viral video of 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra who was seen running in the night in Noida, former Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "He will be a winner." "Champions are made like this...whether on sports field or anything they do in life," he wrote. Former England cricketer Kevin Pietersen said, "This will make your...morning. What a guy!"

57.title: Ambani's Jio World Centre in Mumbai gets armed CISF cover: Report
57.article_body: The Union government has sanctioned armed security cover of over 200 CISF personnel to guard the Jio World Centre opened by Reliance Industries in Mumbai, PTI reported. The business and entertainment centre, spread across 18.5 acres in Bandra Kurla Complex, will receive counter-terrorist cover. Mukesh Ambani and Nita Ambani are protectees of the CRPF VIP security wing.

58.title: Burn more bodies per day: S Korea to crematoriums amid rising COVID deaths
58.article_body: Amid rising number of COVID-19 deaths, health officials in South Korea have ordered crematoriums to burn more bodies per day and funeral homes to add more refrigerators to store dead bodies. South Korea is witnessing a COVID-19 surge due to the Omicron variant. So far, the country has reported more than 99.3 lakh virus cases and over 13,140 coronavirus-related deaths.

59.title: Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy to virtually address Japanese Parliament
59.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will virtually address the Japanese Parliament on Wednesday amid Russia's ongoing military offensive in Ukraine. Zelenskyy, who has also made virtual addresses in US Congress and Parliaments of Israel and Canada, is expected to speak for about 10 minutes. Notably, Japan has adopted sanctions against Russia and also sent non-lethal military aid to Ukraine.

60.title: US lawmakers raise concerns around Musk's business in China: WSJ
60.article_body: Some US lawmakers have raised concerns over Elon Musk-owned SpaceX's ties in China, questioning if Beijing could exploit the ties to gain access to classified information through its foreign suppliers, the WSJ reported. Utah's Representative Chris Stewart reportedly said, "I am a fan of Elon Musk...but anyone would be concerned if there are financial entanglements with China."

61.title: Woman arrested with 2 kg cannabis in Noida's Sector 81: Police
61.article_body: A married woman was arrested with two kgs of cannabis in Noida, police officials said on Monday. The "accused...was held near the Sector 81 metro station road close to Shiv Shakti Enclave", they added. "An FIR has been lodged against her...under the provisions of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act," they further said.

62.title: CBI to probe Gurugram's Chintels society incident: Haryana CM Khattar
62.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday announced in the state assembly that the Chintels society incident would be probed by the CBI. Two women were killed after a portion of a tower collapsed at Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso society in Sector-109. Following the incident, an FIR was registered against the builder, contractor and five other parties.

63.title: Ghaziabad civic body starts construction of 5 sports facilities
63.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has started constructing sporting facilities in five different areas in its jurisdiction. "The corporation maintains several parks in the city, but people don't prefer to play sports in parks. This is why the corporation decided to develop the...facilities," an official said. Some commercial sports centres will also be developed in Ghaziabad, the official added.

64.title: What is wrong with saffronisation of education system: VP Naidu
64.article_body: Responding to allegations that the BJP government is saffronising India's education system, Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu, said, "what is wrong with saffron?". He further urged Indians at large to give up their "colonial mindset" and learn to take pride in their Indian identity. He added that "Indianisation" of the country's education system is the aim of new education policy.

65.title: Delhi airport to get 2 rainwater storage tanks of total 9 million litre capacity
65.article_body: Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport is setting up two rainwater storage tanks, Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL), the airport's operator, said on Tuesday. "The two reservoirs, one near Terminal 1 and the other near Terminal 2, will become operational in the coming monsoon. These would help the airport store about nine million litres of rainwater," DIAL added.

66.title: Will support Pakistan in defending territorial integrity: China
66.article_body: China has said that it will support Pakistan in "defending its sovereignty, independence and territorial integrity" no matter what changes happen internationally or within the two countries. "China will stick to its friendly policy towards Pakistan, firmly support the Pakistani people in taking a development path that fits their own national conditions," said Foreign Minister Wang Yi.

67.title: We've got praise across the world: Foreign Secy on Pak PM's comments
67.article_body: Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla on Monday said India has received praise from across the world for several of its foreign policy initiatives. "To say that one person (praised our foreign policy) would be wrong," he said when asked about Pakistan PM Imran Khan's comment. Khan had praised India for following an independent foreign policy amid the Ukraine-Russia war.

68.title: Was told I wasn't fat enough; they wanted someone fatter: 'Bhabi...' actor Soma
68.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' fame Soma Rathod spoke about her struggling days in the industry and revealed that she was body-shamed. She said, "I was told I wasn't fat enough and they were looking for someone fatter." "So, I was neither slim nor fat...We do not even get clothes for our size, why don't they make clothes our size?"

69.title: Jobs & I never had to stretch truth during Apple's early days: Wozniak
69.article_body: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak while discussing Apple's early days said Steve Jobs and him never had to "stretch the truth" during those days. "Everything was gold and our Apple II computer was so far ahead of the competition," he said. "We were so far ahead...they (competitors) were trying to do something I had already done five years before," Wozniak added.

70.title: History textbooks in schools aren't fully based on facts: Govt official
70.article_body: History textbooks of the NCERT are criticised as they "are not based entirely on facts", Secretary of the Department of School Education and Literacy (under Education Ministry) has said. History textbooks also offer opinions and arguments, Anita Karwal (also CBSE ex-Chairperson) said, adding, "A child should be able to distinguish between all this and come to a conclusion."

71.title: We didn't get partnerships, it cost us the game vs India: B'desh captain Sultana
71.article_body: Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana has said that they bowled "wonderfully" against India in their Women's ODI World Cup match. "We put pressure on India at times...but we didn't get enough partnerships...That's what cost us the game," she stated. Chasing India's 229-run total, Bangladesh lost the match by 110 runs. They will face Australia and England in their remaining two matches.

72.title: Water supply to parts of Pune will be affected on March 24 & 25
72.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation announced on Tuesday that water supply in parts of the city will be cut off on March 24 due to urgent maintenance work. Moreover, it added that on March 25, water will be supplied at low pressure. The areas that will be affected include Dattawadi premises, Deccan premises, Ekalavya College premises, MES and HE Factory, among others.

73.title: Pune Police increase patrolling in hilly areas after robbery incident
73.article_body: Pune Police said they have intensified patrolling in hilly areas after a recent robbery was reported at the city's Pashan Hill. Police referred to an incident that occurred on Friday, wherein three people threatened a duo and compelled them to digitally transfer ₹76,000. "We [advise] people to exercise caution and avoid going [to] these areas when it's dark," police added.

74.title: Campus Activewear gets SEBI's nod for IPO launch
74.article_body: Footwear brand Campus Activewear has received market regulator SEBI's approval for an IPO launch. Promoters Hari Krishan Agarwal and Nikhil Aggarwal will cumulatively sell 1.4 crore shares of the 5.1 crore shares that will be offered for sale by promoters and investors. The money raised will go to the shareholders and the company will not receive any of the funds.

75.title: Lalu suffering from heart & kidney issues, to be shifted to AIIMS Delhi: Doctor
75.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is hospitalised in Jharkhand's Ranchi, would be shifted to AIIMS Delhi as he is facing heart and kidney-related issues, a doctor said. Lalu has been sentenced to five years in prison by a special CBI court in connection with the fifth fodder scam case. He has previously been convicted in four fodder scam cases.

76.title: He's got amazing attitude, vantage point as wicketkeeper: Ashwin on Samson
76.article_body: Praising 27-year-old wicketkeeper-batter and RR skipper Sanju Samson, Ravichandran Ashwin said he has a great attitude for the game and will definitely get better in future. "He's always open for discussion, open to opinions around the game," he added. "Sanju has got the vantage point as a wicketkeeper to judge the game with all the angles," Ashwin further said.

77.title: Policeman injured in shootout with terrorists in J&K; critical
77.article_body: A policeman was injured in a shootout between terrorists and security forces near the Zoonimar area of Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, police said, adding that he is critical. The policeman has been shifted to a nearby hospital. The police added that a terrorist was also injured but he probably ran away from the spot.

78.title: Punjab govt makes 35,000 temporary employees of Group C and D permanent
78.article_body: Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government on Tuesday said that it has decided to make 35,000 temporary employees of Group C and D permanent. "Today, Aam Aadmi Party Punjab government has taken another historic decision...started the process to regularise 35,000 contractual government employees," Mann tweeted. "I've directed Chief Secretary to end such contractual and outsourcing recruitments," he said.

79.title: Govt made 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free to spread hatred: Former J&K CM
79.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday said the central government wants to "further spread hatred in people's hearts" by making the movie 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free. "They (government) are saying that every policeman and soldier...should see this movie, so that they hate us to the extreme," he added. "It is a propaganda movie," Abdullah further said.

80.title: Why can't we make films like 'Avengers', 'White House Down': John
80.article_body: Actor John Abraham speaking to the media stated, "Be it 'Avengers' or 'White House Down', why can't we make such films?" The actor further said that the Indian film industry can make films which can make the world see and say 'Wow, India can make such films too'. "If Hollywood can do it, why can't Bollywood?" John added.

81.title: Yamuna will be cleaned by Dec 2023, not 2025: Satyendar Jain
81.article_body: Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday advanced the deadline for cleaning Yamuna from 2025 to December 2023. Wastewater will be tapped in next six months and all areas will be linked to the sewer network in next 15 months, Jain said. "We'll invite you to take a dip in any stretch of the river in Delhi," he added.

82.title: Pic of govt official's signature goes viral; people say 'how will banks verify?
82.article_body: The signature of an official at the Gauhati Medical College and Hospital has gone viral on social media. Several Twitter users reacted to the signature, with one of them saying, "How will banks verify? Will they count the number of quills the porcupine has?" "Ask him to sign again...will not be able to match same number of loops," said another.

83.title: Was filled with energy by Ponting's speech, felt goosebumps: Sakariya
83.article_body: Fast bowler Chetan Sakariya, who will represent DC in IPL 2022, said, "I had heard a lot about [DC head coach] Ricky Ponting...that you will feel goosebumps [while]...in the huddle and that is exactly what happened." "The moment he ended his speech, I was filled with so much energy that I thought of...knocking the stumps over by bowling," added Sakariya.

84.title: ED searches premises linked to Nawab Malik in Mumbai's Kurla
84.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday searched premises linked to Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik in Mumbai's Kurla. ED had arrested Malik in a money-laundering case linked to gangster Dawood Ibrahim and his aides on February 23. On Monday, a special court extended Malik's judicial custody till April 4 and allowed him to be provided with a mattress, bed and chair.

85.title: 165 kg ganja worth over ₹6 lakh seized in Odisha, 2 arrested
85.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of Odisha Police seized 165 kg of ganja worth over ₹6 lakh and arrested two people. The accused were apprehended during a raid  in Angul district on Monday. According to police, one of the accused is an employee of a nationalised bank. Police also seized one single barrel gun from their possession.

86.title: Japan summons Russian envoy after Moscow halts peace treaty talks
86.article_body: Japan's Vice Foreign Minister Takeo Mori summoned Russia's ambassador to Japan on Tuesday, Foreign Ministry said. This comes after Moscow decided to halt peace treaty talks with Tokyo in response to sanctions imposed by Japan over the Ukraine invasion. Russia and Japan have still not formally ended World War II hostilities due to a dispute over islands north of Hokkaido.

87.title: After what happened in SA, Team India didn't want to take chances: Gavaskar
87.article_body: Discussing pitches for Team India's 2-0 whitewash in the Test series against Sri Lanka, Sunil Gavaskar said, "After what happened in South Africa, it is understandable that they...prepared pitches that suited their strength." South Africa beat India by a 2-1 margin in the three-match Test series, with India yet to record a maiden Test series win on South African soil.

88.title: PM Modi-led govt not at all reluctant to loot poor: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
88.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Tuesday said that PM Narendra Modi-led government is not at all reluctant to "loot" the poor. "We said that there'll be an exorbitant rise in fuel prices post the Assembly elections, we have been proven right," Chowdhury added. "We'll stand against this for common people both outside and inside the Lok Sabha," Chowdhury stated.

89.title: Save water, adopt sustainable practices: RS Chairman Naidu urges MPs
89.article_body: On the occasion of 'World Water Day', Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu requested parliamentarians to conserve water. "We must adopt sustainable water management practices both in personal and public life and sensitise one and all in inculcating water conservation techniques," Naidu said. He further stressed on the importance of groundwater for the sustenance of life.

90.title: If somebody says you've to leave job for house, he isn't right partner: Shweta
90.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari said that if someone asks one to leave their job for house [work], then he isn't the right partner. "You can't leave your security. Nobody tells you to leave your dreams and independence for your family," she said in a video, adding, "The right partner stands with you and supports you to be independent."

91.title: Priyanka Chopra to co-host pre-Oscars event on South Asian Excellence
91.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra will be co-hosting a pre-Oscars event celebrating South Asian Excellence on Wednesday in Beverly Hills. Mindy Kaling, Kumail Nanjiani, Anjula Acharia, Bela Bajaria and Maneesh K among others will also be co-hosts. Special guests for the event include writers and producers of Indian documentary 'Writing With Fire' Rintu Thomas, Sushmit Ghosh and Anurima Bhargava.

92.title: Doctor couple denied bail over fake COVID vaccination camp in Mumbai
92.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai has denied bail to a doctor couple, Neeta Pataria and Shivraj Pataria, for allegedly being involved in a fake COVID-19 vaccination camp in June last year. Nearly 206 people were given bogus vaccines and the couple was given ₹3 lakh as fees, claimed the police. The court said the couple played with people's lives.

93.title: Mayor of Ukrainian city advises civilians to flee as battle nears
93.article_body: With the Russian forces coming close, the mayor of Ukraine's Boryspil has advised the civilians to flee. "There is no need to be in the city now as there is already fighting going on in the area around it. I call on the civilian population to be smart and leave as soon as an opportunity arises," said Mayor Volodymyr Borysenko.

94.title: Ukraine-returned medical students in K'taka to continue studies in 60 colleges
94.article_body: The Karnataka government will help 700 medical students, who returned to the state from war-hit Ukraine, continue their education in 60 medical colleges in the state, state Health and Medical Education Minister K Sudhakar said. Sudhakar, however, added that the students will not be officially absorbed into the colleges. No additional fee will be charged from the students, he said.

95.title: Which are the highest revenue-generating football clubs as per Deloitte Money League?
95.article_body: Manchester City have topped the Deloitte Football Money League for the first time as the world's highest revenue-generating club in 2020-21 season. Manchester City topped the list with €644.9-million revenue. They were followed by Real Madrid (€640.7 million) and Bayern Munich (€611.4 million). Barcelona dropped three places to be ranked fourth on the list with €582.1-million revenue.

96.title: Russian Grandmaster Sergey Karjakin banned for 6 months over pro-Russia comments
96.article_body: Russian Grandmaster Sergey Karjakin has been banned from competition for six months by the International Chess Federation (FIDE) over his pro-Russia comments amid war with Ukraine. After being banned, Karjakin, who represented Ukraine before adopting Russian citizenship in 2009, said, "First...I am a patriot of my country and only second of all I am an athlete. I don't regret anything."

97.title: Why is temperature above normal in March this year?
97.article_body: With several states/UTs recording above normal temperature in March this year, IMD's Director General Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said one of the reason could be that there were no active western disturbances, which bring colder winds. The lack of pre-monsoon showers has contributed to the overall heating. Hot winds from deserts of northwest India contribute to soaring temperatures in central regions.

98.title: Plane crash with 132 on board is China's 1st fatal accident in 12 years
98.article_body: With 132 people on board, the plane crash that took place on Monday is the first fatal accident in China in 12 years. China's last plane crash was in 2010 when an Embraer E-190 regional jet flown by Henan Airlines crashed due to low visibility, killing 44 of 96 people on board. No survivors have been found from Monday's crash.

99.title: Suzuki, SkyDrive partner to develop, market electric aircraft
99.article_body: Japan's Suzuki Motor has signed a deal with SkyDrive to partner up for research, development and marketing of electric, vertical takeoff and landing aircraft. The firms said they will also work to open up new markets with an initial focus on India. SkyDrive is currently focussing on development of a compact, two-seating electric-powered flying car with plans for full-scale production.

100.title: RSS is similar to Jinnah, both divide people: Assam AIUDF MLA
100.article_body: An All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) MLA from Assam, Rafiqul Islam, has equated RSS to Pakistan's founder Muhammad Ali Jinnah. "Jinnah divided the country into two parts - India and Pakistan...BJP and RSS are also doing the same thing, and they are dividing Hindu and Muslim, Dalits and non-Dalits," the MLA from Jania constituency said.

101.title: Heat in Gurugram likely to rise, temp to cross 41°C by end of this week
101.article_body: IMD has predicted the maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 41°C by the end of this week. It said the maximum temperature in the city is likely to increase by five degrees and hover around 41°C by Saturday. Gurugram recorded a maximum temperature of 37.8°C on Sunday, the highest temperature the city has seen so far this year.

102.title: Wallets, ID cards of people presumed dead in China plane crash found
102.article_body: Wallets, bank cards and official identity cards, that belonged to the 132 people presumed dead in the China Eastern Airlines crash, were found on a mountainside on Tuesday. The items were lined up by rescue workers scouring the mountainside. The Boeing 737 aircraft, travelling from Kunming to Guangzhou on Monday, is believed to have 'nosedived' before crashing in the mountains.

103.title: Adil criticised over his tweet on 'The Kashmir…', actor says it was 'ill-timed'
103.article_body: Adil Hussain was criticised for his tweet on 'The Kashmir Files', where he shared his views on the film and tweeted, "Truth must be spoken but tenderly or else truth loses its beauty". Reacting to it, a user wrote, "If you're Muslim then no matter what you'll support Terrorism." Later, Adil apologised and called it "the most ill-timed tweet ever".

104.title: Shiv Sena will always remain a Hindutva party: Sanjay Raut
104.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that his party was a "Hindutva party" and will always remain the same. "The question of political ideology should be asked to BJP when they formed government with Mehbooba Mufti in Kashmir, where did their political ideology go?" he added. Earlier, Raut had said that BJP is doing politics on a sensitive issue like Kashmir.

105.title: Bill to merge 3 municipal corporations of Delhi cleared by Cabinet
105.article_body: The Union Cabinet on Tuesday cleared the Delhi Municipal Corporation Amendment Act 2022, for the unification of all three municipal corporations of Delhi. Reportedly, the bill will be tabled in the Parliament next week. Earlier, State Election Commission delayed the MCD polls after receiving communication regarding the unification. Subsequently, AAP criticised the Centre for pressurising SEC.

106.title: Delhi govt to build Shaheed Bhagat Singh Armed Forces Preparatory School
106.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday announced that the Delhi government will build Shaheed Bhagat Singh Armed Forces Preparatory School. The school, where students will be trained for the armed forces, will be built on 14 acres of land in Jharoda Kalan, he added. "The fees for the school will be free...will have separate hostels for boys and girls," Kejriwal stated.

107.title: Opposition walks out of Lok Sabha over fuel, cooking gas price hike
107.article_body: Members of the opposition parties staged a protest in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday against the rise in prices of petrol, diesel and domestic cooking gas. They then staged a walkout demanding a rollback. Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked by 80 paise a litre and domestic cooking gas prices have been increased by ₹50 per cylinder.

108.title: I've been out of work for 3yrs, people lost faith in me: Bobby Deol
108.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has stated that he has seen his lows and was out of work for almost three years. "It's not that people didn't want to work with me, it's just that they lost faith in me," he added. Bobby further said it's a fight to find good work, adding that people who perform well keep getting good work.

109.title: OYO to offer free accommodation to Ukrainian refugees
109.article_body: OYO said it'll offer free accommodation to refugees fleeing from Ukraine. Starting with Poland, efforts are being undertaken to appeal to over 600 of OYO's Belvilla homeowners to open their holiday homes to refugees, the company said. OYO said it has also started a campaign to collect funds to help homeowners who agree to provide free accommodation to refugees.

110.title: Japan issues blackout alert, urges people to save electricity
110.article_body: Japan on Tuesday sounded a blackout alert after operations at several power plants halted owing to the recent earthquake. The Tokyo Electric Power Company has warned that 20-30 lakh households could lose power soon at the current power usage rate. The government has urged citizens, businesses and local authorities to minimise electricity usage.

111.title: Man escapes Pune lockup through gap between 2 iron rods, arrested within 2 hrs
111.article_body: A 19-year-old man was rearrested after he escaped through a gap between two iron rods of the door of a Pune police station lockup. While the man was arrested within two hours of his escape, a police official said that he took advantage of his slim physique and an extra rod will be added to cover the gap.

112.title: Russia's attempt to capture Kyiv is suicide: Ukrainian official
112.article_body: Ukrainian presidential adviser Oleksiy Arestovych on Tuesday said that one of Russia's main priorities is to take control of Ukraine's capital Kyiv but trying to do so is "suicide". He also said that active hostilities between Ukraine and Russia could end within 2-3 weeks. Russian and Ukrainian officials have held several rounds of talks since the start of the conflict.

113.title: I was surprised that Yashasvi Jaiswal was retained by RR: Jaffer
113.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he was surprised when 20-year-old Yashasvi Jaiswal was retained by RR along with Sanju Samson and Jos Buttler. "When you are a retained player, there is a different responsibility...how [Yashasvi] handles the pressure will be interesting to see," he added. Yashasvi scored 249 runs in 10 matches last IPL season.

114.title: Mali’s ex-Prime Minister Soumeylou Maiga dies in detention
114.article_body: Mali's former PM Soumeylou Maiga, arrested over corruption allegations last year, has died due to an undisclosed illness, one of his lawyers said. The 67-year-old died at a clinic in Bamako on Monday, where he'd been hospitalised since December, the lawyer added. Reportedly, the military government had refused his family's request to allow Maiga to travel abroad for treatment.

115.title: 96-year-old World War II Holocaust survivor killed in shelling in Ukraine
115.article_body: A 96-year-old Holocaust survivor, Boris Romanchenko, was killed in Russian shelling in Ukraine. Buchenwald memorial institute said that Romanchenko had survived the Nazi camps at Buchenwald, Peenemunde, Dora and Bergen-Belsen during World War II. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Please think about how many things he has come through but he was killed by a Russian strike."

116.title: Let's see how Umran performs with pressure of expectations in IPL: Jaffer
116.article_body: Talking about Umran Malik, who was retained by SRH for ₹4 crore before IPL mega auction 2022,  Wasim Jaffer said it remains to be seen how the 22-year-old pacer performs with pressure of expectations in upcoming IPL. "He's somebody who bowls 150 clicks (kmph)," he added. Umran made his IPL debut last season and took two wickets from three matches.

117.title: Man stalks woman, claims she is a sex worker; arrested in Mumbai
117.article_body: A 58-year-old man, Venu Koli, has been arrested for allegedly stalking and sexually harassing a 38-year-old woman in south Mumbai. The victim said Koli had uploaded a message on his Whatsapp status, claiming that she was a sex worker. She alleged that he got CCTV cameras installed in her residential area and would upload her videos on platforms like YouTube.

118.title: 2 women rescued as Noida Police bust online sex racket; 1 arrested
118.article_body: Noida Police have rescued two women and arrested one person as they busted a sex racket that was being run through online booking, an official said. During interrogation, the accused revealed he used to send women to different houses and hotels after contacting his customers through the internet and WhatsApp. He collected huge amounts of money from the customers daily.

119.title: Rahul Mahajan's ex-wife Dimpy Ganguly announces third pregnancy, shares pic
119.article_body: Rahul Mahajan's ex-wife, model Dimpy Ganguly, announced her third pregnancy. Taking to Instagram, Dimpy shared a photo flaunting her baby bump, in which her two kids can also be seen by her side. She captioned the post, "The most...fulfilling love I've ever experienced is the love I have received from my babies...Can't believe very soon this love will become x3!"

120.title: The Fame Game's Gagan Arora marries longtime girlfriend, shares pics
120.article_body: Actor Gagan Arora, who portrayed Madhav in 'The Fame Game', has announced that he married longtime girlfriend Muditaa last month. Gagan shared pictures from the wedding, writing, "With a lot of restrictions and a very small gathering...we started this new journey." He further wrote that 12 years ago, he looked at Muditaa and told his friends he will marry her.

121.title: We did well to get to 229 after losing 3 wickets in 5 balls vs B'desh: Mithali
121.article_body: After defeating Bangladesh by 110 runs in the Women's ODI World Cup, India captain Mithali Raj said they did well to post the 229-run total despite losing the first three wickets in five balls during their innings. "Having all-rounders definitely gives the cushion of batting deep," she added. India have now won three of their six games in the tournament.

122.title: New batteries for Delhi remote control: Sidhu on AAP's RS nominee choices
122.article_body: Taking a jibe at Aam Aadmi Party's Rajya Sabha nominee choices, Congress leader Navjot Sidhu said, "New batteries for the Delhi remote control, it's blinking... Harbhajan is an exception, the rest are batteries and betrayal of Punjab." Earlier, the AAP party rivals had claimed that Arvind Kejriwal intends to "control" the new Punjab government from the national capital.

123.title: B'luru man slits wife's throat in front of kids, then dies by suicide
123.article_body: Sampath, a 36-year-old factory worker, slit his wife's throat in front of their children and later died by suicide on Monday morning in Bengaluru's Attibele. According to police, the couple got into a fight and Sampath later slit his wife's throat while she was sleeping. He also stabbed one of their minor sons as he moved to help the victim.

124.title: 125-yr-old Padma awardee Swami Sivananda eats oil-free food, wakes up at 3 am
124.article_body: Yoga guru Swami Sivananda who received Padma Shri on Monday had revealed earlier that he eats food that is free of oil and spices and prefers eating rice and boiled daal with some green chillies. The 125-year-old wakes up at 3 am and follows a rigorous daily routine. A video of him kneeling before PM Narendra Modi had gone viral.

125.title: Will run govt transparently, make U'khand best state of India: Dhami
125.article_body: Uttarakhand CM-designate Pushkar Singh Dhami said on Tuesday that he'll ensure his administration's work reaches people at the grassroots. "We will run our government in complete transparency and make Uttarakhand the best out of all the states in the country," Dhami added. Dhami, who lost from Khatima Assembly constituency, will take oath as CM for a second term on Wednesday.

126.title: Son no longer named Wolf, we didn't feel like it was him: Kylie Jenner
126.article_body: American reality television personality Kylie Jenner took to Instagram Stories to announce that her son is no longer named Wolf. She wrote, "We just really didn't feel like it was him. Just wanted to share because I keep seeing Wolf everywhere." Her announcement came hours after she shared a YouTube video showing intimate footage leading up to her son's birth.

127.title: Pradeep an inspiration, firmly placed in millions of Indians' hearts: Smriti
127.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani took to Instagram to share post for Pradeep Mehra, a 19-year-old youth, who was spotted running on roads of Noida in a bid to prepare for joining the Indian Army. "Pradeep...a hero...hopeful for a place in the Indian Army now firmly placed in the heart of millions of Indians...an inspiration," read the post by Smriti Irani.

128.title: Faf Du Plessis commands a lot of respect, doesn't demand it: Kohli
128.article_body: Talking about new RCB captain Faf Du Plessis, former RCB captain Virat Kohli said, "Du Plessis commands a lot of respect, does not demand it because he has been there and done that." "I messaged him as soon as he was picked for RCB. It was official after, but I knew obviously," added Kohli.

129.title: To carry the hopes of billions for years was sensational: Lara on Tendulkar
129.article_body: Talking about Sachin Tendulkar, Brian Lara said, "To carry the hopes of billions for...years was sensational. We have always kept in touch, there is mutual respect. What I like the most...is his humility." Lara termed late Australian cricketer Shane Warne as the greatest leg-spinner ever. "Facing him was a challenge. We have been involved in some fascinating duels," added Lara.

130.title: Russia bars its scientists from international conferences
130.article_body: Russian scientists will not participate in international conferences this year, Russia's Ministry of Science and Higher Education said. "We are not calling for abandoning publications in Web of Science and Scopus (academic resources)," Minister Valery Falkov said in a statement. "We need to act in accordance with our national interests," he added.

131.title: ED questions TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee in coal scam case for 8 hrs in Delhi
131.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday questioned TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee at its New Delhi office for nearly eight hours in connection with the coal scam case. Banerjee reached the Central agency's office at around 11 am yesterday and left shortly before 8 pm. He was accompanied by his security personnel and legal team.

132.title: 2 women among 10 arrested for attacking police during Holi in Karnal
132.article_body: At least 10 persons, including two women, were arrested by the Karnal police for allegedly damaging a police vehicle, injuring three police officials and creating ruckus in a government hospital after a clash over Holi celebrations in Karnal. The incident took place during a clash between the two groups during Holi celebrations.

133.title: Doctors told to remove genitals of captured Russians in Ukraine
133.article_body: The owner of a war-zone mobile hospital in Ukraine has instructed his doctors to remove genitals of captured Russian soldiers. "I have always been a great humanist...But now [I gave] very strict orders to castrate all [captured Russian] men, because they are cockroaches, not people," the 49-year-old owner said. Since 2014, around 500 doctors have worked with his mobile hospital.

134.title: Which were the most polluted cities in India and Pakistan in 2021?
134.article_body: India was home to 11 of the 15 most polluted cities in Central and South Asia in 2021, with the remaining four cities being from Pakistan, as per World Air Quality Report. Bhiwadi was the most polluted city in India, followed by Ghaziabad, Delhi and Jaunpur. Faisalabad was the most polluted city in Pakistan, followed by Bahawalpur, Peshawar and Lahore.

135.title: Please stop bothering Pradeep Mehra for interviews: Kapri requests media outlets
135.article_body: Filmmaker Vinod Kapri on Monday requested media organisations to stop bothering 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra for interviews. Kapri's initial video of Mehra running in Noida at midnight had been widely circulated on social media and received reactions from various celebrities. "You can use my videos without permission...Just let that kid live his life. Stop this spectacle," Kapri added.

136.title: HUL in talks to buy majority stake in MDH at ₹10,000 crore-₹15,000 crore valuation: Report
136.article_body: FMCG major Hindustan Unilever Ltd is in discussions to buy a majority stake in MDH Spices, Livemint reported on Tuesday. MDH could be valued between ₹10,000 crore and ₹15,000 crore, the report added. MDH Spices is said to have been in discussions with other conglomerates too after the demise of Founder Mahashay Dharampal Gulati, who passed away in December 2020.

137.title: It will shake you to core, I cried in 1st meeting: Vipul on 'The Kerala Story'
137.article_body: Sunshine Pictures has announced the movie 'The Kerala Story' based on "true stories of about 32,000 girls and counting". "This story is a human tragedy, one that will shake you to the core. When Sudipto came and narrated it...along with his research of over 3-4 years, I was in tears in the first meeting itself," producer Vipul Shah said.

138.title: Have high hopes for Sarfaraz Khan this time: Wasim Jaffer
138.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he has high hopes for Sarfaraz Khan, who was bought by DC for ₹20 lakh. "Sarfaraz has played at number five, six and seven mostly...this year we might get to see him bat at three or four," Jaffer explained. Sarfaraz has scored a total of 33 runs in the last two IPL seasons.

139.title: Russian court finds Putin critic Navalny guilty of fraud
139.article_body: A Russian court on Tuesday found President Vladimir Putin's jailed critic Alexey Navalny guilty of fraud and embezzlement charges. Russian prosecutors are seeking to move Navalny to a maximum security prison for 13 years. Navalny called the charges against him "politically motivated". He is currently serving a two-and-a-half-year sentence at a prison camp in Moscow for parole violations.

140.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami to take oath as U'khand CM for 2nd time tomorrow
140.article_body: Uttarakhand CM-designate Pushkar Singh Dhami will take oath as the Chief Minister for the second time in Dehradun on Wednesday. The ceremony will be held at 3.30 pm at the Parade Ground. Dhami, who lost from the Khatima seat in the Assembly polls, was elected leader of the BJP legislature party in Uttarakhand on Monday.

141.title: Over 5,000 planets exist beyond our solar system, confirms NASA
141.article_body: NASA confirmed that more than 5,000 planets exist beyond our solar system, representing a 30-year journey of discovery led by NASA space telescopes. The number of confirmed exoplanets crossed the 5,000-mark on March 21, with the latest batch of 65 exoplanets – planets outside our immediate solar family. The 5,000-plus planets found so far include small, rocky worlds like Earth.

142.title: No plans to make Tripura dry state, no proof that prohibition works: Govt
142.article_body: There are no plans to make Tripura a dry state, said Deputy Chief Minister Jishnu Dev Varma on Monday. "There is no scientific evidence that substantiates the claim that a ban on alcohol sales would reduce consumption," he added. The minister said the government is acting against illegal brewers, dealers and stockists of alcohol across the state.

143.title: Ranveer, Jacqueline are class apart when it comes to dancing: Govinda
143.article_body: In a recent interview, when asked who would be perfect to take his and actress Karisma Kapoor's place as a hit on-screen Jodi, actor Govinda replied, "I think today, from the younger crop, Ranveer Singh and Jacqueline Fernandez are both a class apart when it comes to dancing." "I think they would make a great Jodi as well," he added.

144.title: CM Yogi resigns as MLC ahead of oath-taking ceremony on March 25
144.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has tendered his resignation from the UP Legislative Council days after getting elected as an MLA from the Gorakhpur Urban constituency. CM Yogi was elected to the UP Legislative Council soon after becoming the state's CM in 2017. The 49-year-old politician is likely to take oath as CM again during the ceremony on March 25.

145.title: Police officer injured after car hits him in Hyd; video surfaces
145.article_body: A police officer was injured after a BMW car knocked him down on Hyderabad's Tank Bund on Monday. A video of the incident has surfaced online. A police inspector told Telangana Today that the police officer was crossing the road to check something when the car hit him, following which he fell on the car and then on the road.

146.title: Tesla to hand over 1st Model Ys made at its German Gigafactory
146.article_body: Tesla will hand over the first Model Y vehicles made at its German Gigafactory plant to clients on Tuesday. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will attend Tuesday's ceremony alongside Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk. "Excited to hand over the first production cars made by Giga Berlin-Brandenburg," Musk said on Twitter. Tesla plans to hire 12,000 workers for the plant.

147.title: Akhilesh quits as Lok Sabha MP after winning 1st Assembly poll
147.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh CM and Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has resigned as Lok Sabha MP, days after he won his first Assembly poll from Karhal in UP. He had won from Azamgarh Lok Sabha constituency in the 2019 election. With 1,48,196 votes, he defeated his closest rival from BJP, Prof SP Singh Baghel, in Karhal.

148.title: Ex-ABVP chief who urinated in front of woman's home granted bail
148.article_body: Madras High Court on Monday granted interim bail to former ABVP National President Dr Subbiah Shanmugam for allegedly harassing a 62-year-old woman by urinating in front of her house and throwing surgical masks in 2020. The court did so saying that Subbiah was arrested on a public holiday and questioned why the arrest happened "1.5 years after complaint was filed".

149.title: 6 arrested for performing bike stunts on Chennai's Kamarajar Salai
149.article_body: Police have arrested six men who performed dangerous motorcycle stunts on Kamarajar Salai near Marina Beach in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. Expensive motorbikes, including those from brands KTM, Yamaha and Activa, have been seized from the bikers. Police said it is illegal to modify bikes and mechanics have been directed to inform police if youngsters ask them to modify their two-wheelers.

150.title: Tiger electrocuted in trap laid for wild boars in MP, 4 arrested
150.article_body: A tiger was electrocuted in a trap laid for wild boars in Balaghat district of Madhya Pradesh, a forest official said on Tuesday. The tiger, about 10 to 12 years old, was found buried under the sand in a forest area near Ratta village, Narendra Sanodia, chief conservator of forest, said. Four people were arrested in connection with the killing.

151.title: Issues of Kashmiri Pandits never came in newspapers: Brahmin group member
151.article_body: BK Premananda Kamath from Kerala, who is a member of the Gaud Saraswat Brahmin community, said 'The Kashmir Files' is a "heart-wrenching" movie. "I remember these issues had never come in the newspapers, except saying that one Hindu was killed and a Pandit was killed...We never knew that so many atrocities had happened to the Hindus back then," he added.

152.title: RR have fantastic attack and I'm here to guide them to deliver their best: Malinga
152.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka pacer Lasith Malinga, who has been roped by RR as their fast bowling coach, has said the franchise has a fantastic pace attack and he's there to guide the pacers to deliver their best. "[It's a] talented group of bowlers...we've got experienced overseas players like Boult and Coulter-Nile...genuine Indian fast bowlers in Prasidh and Saini," Malinga added.

153.title: T'gana BJP MP slams CM KCR for politicising paddy procurement
153.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao demanded that the Centre buy the entire paddy crop produced in the state, BJP MP D Arvind slammed the former for politicising paddy procurement. "The TRS government has to give around 5,00,000 tonnes of paddy to the Centre, but they're not doing that...instead, Telangana government is black marketing it," the Nizamabad MP added.

154.title: 10 dead as mob sets houses on fire in WB's Birbhum after TMC leader's murder
154.article_body: At least 10 people died after a mob allegedly set 10-12 houses on fire in West Bengal's Birbhum on Monday, fire officials said. "A total of 10 dead bodies have been recovered...seven bodies...retrieved from a single house," officials added. This comes after a TMC panchayat leader of Barshal village in Birbhum, Bhadu Sheikh, was killed in an alleged bomb attack.

155.title: Will be a big call by KKR to bowl Varun in death overs: Irfan Pathan
155.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said, "I think KKR can [sort their death bowling]...by adding a couple of overs of Varun Chakaravarthy. It's...a big call." KKR had economy rates of 9.24 runs per over and 8.28 runs per over respectively in the Indian and UAE leg of IPL 2021. Shreyas Iyer will lead KKR in IPL 2022.

156.title: Lockdown imposed on fuel prices lifted: Rahul Gandhi mocks PM Modi
156.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi-led government over hike in fuel prices. "The lockdown imposed on gas, diesel and petrol prices has been lifted. The government will now regularly do 'vikas' (development) in prices," tweeted Gandhi. "If PM is questioned about the inflation epidemic, he would say 'Thali Bajao' (bang plates)," he added.

157.title: Chennai civic body proposes to cancel licenses of shops violating plastic ban
157.article_body: The Chennai civic body is planning to cancel licences of shops and other establishments, which continue to sell banned plastic items in the city. The proposal comes in response to a writ petition from Tamil Nadu and Puducherry Plastic Manufacturers Association, challenging the state government's order, banning production and sale of 14 types of plastic items from January 1, 2019.

158.title: Sri Lanka sends troops to oversee fuel distribution amid economic crisis
158.article_body: Sri Lanka ordered its military to post soldiers at hundreds of gas stations to help distribute fuel amid a widespread shortage caused by the economic crisis in the country. "At least two...personnel will be deployed at every fuel pump," a military spokesman Nilantha Premaratne said. This comes after three people collapsed and died while waiting in queues to buy fuel.

159.title: They believe it's real me: Sudhanshu on his misogynistic character in Anupamaa
159.article_body: Speaking about his "misogynist" character in 'Anupamaa', actor Sudhanshu Pandey said he has been subjected to unending criticism for what 'Vanraj' does on the show. He added, "It was new to me because I wasn't part of the television industry." "They start believing...what I play on show is the real me...I had to bear the trolling...on social media," he said.

160.title: AAP's Sanjay Singh asks party workers to prepare for UP civic polls
160.article_body: AAP on Sunday decided to contest the forthcoming civic polls in UP and also make changes in the party's organisational structure. Presiding over a two-day meeting of AAP state executive, the party's state in-charge Sanjay Singh told party workers to start preparing for the UP civic polls. Singh stated that AAP had emerged as an alternative to other national parties.

161.title: There will be daily 'vikas' in petrol & diesel prices: Mallikarjun Kharge
161.article_body: Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge said that by increasing fuel prices the PM Modi-led government is making money worth ₹10,000 crores by plundering the poor. Taking to Twitter, he said, "Congratulations to PM Modiji for achieving his 'target' of ₹1,000 per LPG cylinder...There will now be daily 'vikas' in petrol and diesel prices as well."

162.title: Sadhguru begins 30,000-km bike tour from London to India for 'Save Soil' campaign
162.article_body: Yoga guru Jaggi Vasudev, also known as Sadhguru, on Monday began his 30,000-kilometre motorbike journey from London to India as part of his 'Save Soil' awareness campaign. The 64-year-old's 100-day tour will take him across Europe and the Middle East, where he'll be meeting celebrities and environmentalists. "I'm not a scientist...but I know there's a soil crisis," he said earlier.

163.title: Read this before the outrage: Zomato CEO shares explainer on 10-minute delivery
163.article_body: After Zomato faced criticism for announcing a 10-minute food delivery service, CEO Deepinder Goyal clarified, "10-minute delivery is as safe for our delivery partners as 30-minute delivery." "Please take 2 minutes to read...this (before the outrage)," he wrote, sharing an explainer. It will only be for items that are standardised and can be dispatched within two minutes, the explainer said.

164.title: Which are the world's most polluted capitals according to World Air Quality Report 2021?
164.article_body: As per the World Air Quality Report 2021 by Swiss organisation IQAir, India's capital Delhi is the world's most polluted capital city with an average annual PM2.5 concentration of 96.4 µg/m3. Delhi is followed by Bangladesh's Dhaka, Chad's N'Djamena, Tajikistan's Dushanbe and Oman's Muscat. Delhi saw an annual increase of 14.6% in PM2.5 concentrations in 2021.

165.title: B'luru ACB conducts search on agents suspected of influencing govt officials
165.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) is conducting searches at locations of nine middlemen and agents suspected of influencing government officials in Bengaluru. The accused are suspected of being involved in malpractices and irregularities in the activities of the Bangalore Development Authority. About 100 officials are conducting the raids under supervision of Uma Prashant, Superintendent of Police.

166.title: India defeat Bangladesh by 110 runs, jump to 3rd on Women's World Cup points table
166.article_body: India defeated Bangladesh by 110 runs to register their third victory in the 2022 Women's World Cup. With the win, India have now jumped to the third spot on the points table. Yastika Bhatia was named Player of the Match for scoring 50(80). Earlier today, Australia handed South Africa their first defeat in 2022 Women's World Cup.

167.title: Makers planning to turn 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' into comic book series: Report
167.article_body: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' makers are planning to turn film into comic book series, Free Press Journal quoted source as saying. "Aditya [Chopra] wants to immortalise character of Jayeshbhai Jordaar...first thing they are planning to do is turn Jayeshbhai into comic book series. They feel character will appeal to universal set of audience...Adi wants...character to get...popular with kids!" source said.

168.title: Jack Ma-led Alibaba increases share buyback size to record $25 bn
168.article_body: Billionaire Jack Ma-led Alibaba has increased its share buyback programme to $25 billion, the largest ever repurchase plan by the e-commerce firm. In August, Alibaba had increased the programme from $10 billion to $15 billion. The firm's board has approved the programme, which will run through March 2024. Alibaba's shares rose 4.8% in Hong Kong following the news.

169.title: 64-yr-old Kerala man gets 73 yrs in jail for molesting 7-yr-old grandson
169.article_body: A Kerala court sentenced a 64-year-old man to 73 years in jail for sexually abusing his seven-year-old grandson in 2019 and fined him ₹1,60,000. The incident came to light after the accused's wife witnessed the crime. The man was awarded 20 years in jail under three sections of POCSO, 10 years for repeated offence and three years under Section 377.

170.title: Two foreign institutes want to set up campuses in India: Govt
170.article_body: Two foreign education institutes, based out of Italy and France, are interested in setting up campuses in India, MoS for Education Subhas Sarkar told Parliament. Milan-based Istituto Marangoni expressed interest to establish a foreign, fully independent higher education institute of fashion and design while the French side wants to set up a university campus for higher education courses, he added.

171.title: Common entrance test for UG admissions in central universities, Class 12 marks won't count
171.article_body: All central universities will have to admit students to undergraduate courses based on the Common University Entrance Test (CUET) and not Class 12 marks, the University Grants Commission (UGC) said on Monday. This rule will come into force from the upcoming academic year 2022-23. The application window for the examination will open in the first week of April.

172.title: Akhilesh repeatedly said fuel prices will rise after polls: Jaya
172.article_body: After fuel prices were raised for the first time in over four months, SP MP Jaya Bachchan on Tuesday said, "This is how the government does." She added that party chief Akhilesh Yadav had "repeatedly" said that people should be alert as "price is going to increase after the elections". "Don't know who brought [BJP] to power," she further said.

173.title: AAP names office-bearers for 9 states, aims to 'expand footprint'
173.article_body: AAP has announced office-bearers for nine states including Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh where elections are due later this year. AAP released the names by posting, "We are all set to increase our footprint throughout India!" AAP's Rajya Sabha nominee Sandeep Pathak has been appointed as incharge of Gujarat and also, he will be replacing Raghav Chadha as co-incharge of Punjab.

174.title: Video shows pre-school kids chant 'We want Biden out' slogans in US
