174.article_body: A video has surfaced showing a teacher leading pre-school children in sloganeering against US President Joe Biden. "Who's our president?" asks the teacher and the children say, "Biden". "What do we want to do with him?" the teacher asks next, to which the children respond, "We want him out!" The California-based school later issued an apology to the parents.

175.title: Didn't know much about Kashmiri Pandits; I feel ashamed of myself: Darshan
175.article_body: Actor Darshan Kumar, who starred in 'The Kashmir Files' said he didn't know much about the Kashmiri Pandits. He added, "I really feel ashamed of myself. Just like today's audience I too was confused and unaware." "I only realised when Vivek Agnihotri and Pallavi Joshi showed me those videos of the first-generation victims. I was totally taken aback," he said.

176.title: Mumbai Police arrests 36 drunk drivers, 115 wrong-side drivers on Holi
176.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police arrested 36 drunk drivers and 115 motorists for driving on the wrong side and penalised 8,276 drivers for various other violations across the city during Holi on Friday. The police officials were unable to use breath analysers due to COVID restrictions and thus they collected blood samples of the drivers which were sent for forensic tests.

177.title: Chiranjeevi, Salman's pic from Godfather sets surfaces, fan says 'Megastars'
177.article_body: Actor Salman Khan has begun shooting for the Telugu film 'Godfather', which is headlined by South actor Chiranjeevi. Recently, a picture from the sets of Godfather has surfaced on Twitter. In the photo, Chiranjeevi and Salman can be seen posing with the director and producers on the set. Commenting on the post, one of the fans wrote, "Two megastars."

178.title: Ukrainian troops reclaim Kyiv suburb Makariv, says Army
178.article_body: The Ukrainian troops have pushed back Russian forces to reclaim the Kyiv suburb of Makariv, said the Army. "The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported on March 21 that the Ukrainian flag was raised over the town of Makariv and Russian forces have been pushed back," reported The Kyiv Independent. Makariv lies 60 km west of Kyiv.

179.title: Completely unacceptable: Japan as Russia halts WW2 peace treaty talks
179.article_body: Japan on Tuesday condemned Russia's decision to abandon talks on a World War II peace treaty because of sanctions imposed by Tokyo over the war in Ukraine. "This entire situation has been created by Russia's invasion of Ukraine, and Russia's response to push this onto Japan-Russia relations is extremely unfair and completely unacceptable," Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said.

180.title: We have been eyeing Shreyas Iyer for years now: KKR CEO Venky Mysore
180.article_body: KKR CEO Venky Mysore has revealed they have been eyeing Shreyas Iyer for years and there was a "sense of real elation" when they bought him for ₹12.25 crore in the IPL mega auction. "We got our captain and a serious match-winner. At this young age, Shreyas has already achieved a lot and he'll only get better," Venky added.

181.title: NMMC cuts salaries of 191 employees for reporting late to work
181.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has cut salaries of 191 employees, including officers, for one-three days for reporting late to work, the civic body said. Following complaints, a surprise check was conducted on two occasions last month during which it was found that several employees reported late for work despite being warned against it, a senior official said.

182.title: Mumbai youth killed as friend without licence rides bike in wrong direction
182.article_body: A 19-year-old boy was arrested in Mumbai for driving a motorbike without a license, leading to the death of his 18-year-old friend, who was riding pillion, police said. The accident took place when three friends were returning home on a bike. The 19-year-old boy entered a one-way street from the wrong direction and was blinded by an approaching car's headlight.

183.title: 2-month-old girl found dead inside microwave oven in Delhi, mother main suspect: Police
183.article_body: A two-month-old girl was found dead inside a microwave oven at her home in Delhi. The baby's grandfather alleged, "We think her mother killed her...She was unhappy with her." A police officer said the mother of the child is the main suspect. DCP Benita Mary Jaiker said, "The cause of death is yet to be ascertained. We're questioning family members."

184.title: Which were the world's most polluted countries in 2021 as per World Air Quality Report?
184.article_body: As per the World Air Quality Report 2021 by Swiss organisation IQAir, Bangladesh was the most polluted country last year. Bangladesh was followed by Chad, Pakistan and Tajikistan. Meanwhile, India was the fifth most polluted country, followed by Oman, Kyrgyzstan, Bahrain, Iraq and Nepal. No country met the latest WHO air quality guideline for PM2.5 in 2021, the report added.

185.title: Bihar's people contributed to nation's development: Prez Kovind on 'Bihar Diwas'
185.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday greeted the people of Bihar on the occasion of 'Bihar Diwas'. "The hardworking and talented people here have contributed significantly to the development of the country," President Kovind, who served as Governor of Bihar from 2015-2017, wrote on Twitter. 'Bihar Diwas' is observed to mark the formation of the state of Bihar.

186.title: 2020, 2021 reminded us that we are human and need God: Justice Pardiwala
186.article_body: Gujarat High Court Justice Jamshed Pardiwala said years 2020 and 2021 have reminded us that we are human and we need God. "There has been an immense loss of lives and livelihoods...the years 2020 and 2021 have taught a lot about ourselves...what has kept us going are faith and hope," he said, adding the two years have been "unarguably horrible".

187.title: Marathi school Class 1 students to learn via bilingual books: Maha Min
187.article_body: Maharashtra School Education Minister Varsha Gaikwad said on Monday that bilingual and integrated books will be introduced for Class 1 students in Marathi medium schools from this academic year. She said that while students "understand better" when taught in their mother tongue, they should also "understand English words (for Marathi words)". Gaikwad was replying to queries in the state Assembly.

188.title: US firm uses waste from coal power plants to mine Bitcoin
188.article_body: US-based Stronghold Digital Mining claims to have devised a method to use waste left behind by coal power plants to power supercomputers working to mine Bitcoin. It collects coal ash from mines and processes it at a waste coal processing facility. The coal ash is sorted and crushed, and sent to a boiler building where it's burned to generate electricity.

189.title: Let's reaffirm our pledge to save every drop of water: PM on World Water Day
189.article_body: On World Water Day, PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that the nation is undertaking numerous measures to ensure water conservation. "On World Water Day, let's reaffirm our pledge to save every drop of water," PM tweeted. "Over the last few years, it's heartening to see water conservation become a mass movement," he added.

190.title: I-T dept raids Hiranandani Group at 24 places in Mumbai, B'luru & Chennai
190.article_body: The Income Tax department on Tuesday conducted raids on several premises linked to Hiranandani Group over suspected tax evasion. The raids were underway at around 24 locations in Mumbai, Chennai and Bengaluru, including residences of some top officials, department officials said. The group, founded by Niranjan and Surendra Hiranandani in 1978, is one of India's largest real estate companies.

191.title: Around 3.1 million trees cut for infra projects across India in 2020-21: Govt
191.article_body: Around 3.1 million trees were cut down for public infrastructure projects across India in 2020-21, Union Minister Bhupender Yadav told the Lok Sabha on Monday. "The permission for tree felling is accorded by the respective state governments/UT administrations under the provisions of various Acts, rules, guidelines and directions of courts," Yadav stated.

192.title: US-Moscow ties close to rupture after Biden's 'war criminal' remark: Russia
192.article_body: Russia on Monday summoned the US ambassador to the country in protest after US President Joe Biden labelled his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin a "war criminal" for Moscow's actions in Ukraine. "Such statements from the American President, unworthy of a statesman of such high rank, put Russian-American relations on the verge of rupture," the Russian Foreign Ministry said.

193.title: Punjab CM declares public holiday on March 23 on occasion of Shaheed Diwas
193.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has declared a public holiday in the state on March 23, on the occasion of Shaheed Diwas or Martyrs' Day. Shaheed Diwas marks the death anniversary of freedom fighters Bhagat Singh, Sukhdev Thapar and Shivaram Rajguru. Punjab Assembly on Tuesday passed a resolution to install statues of Shaheed Bhagat Singh and Babasaheb Ambedkar in the Assembly.

194.title: Delhi's peak power demand may touch 8,000 MW for 1st time: Officials
194.article_body: Delhi's peak power demand may surpass 8,000 MW for the first time this summer after industrial and commercial activities resumed following COVID-19 lockdowns, officials said. Delhi's peak power demand was 7,409 MW which was recorded in 2019, according to BSES. In BSES Yamuna Power Limited areas of East and Central Delhi, the peak demand is expected to surpass 1,800 MW.

195.title: Payal verbally attacked, Kangana seems to agree abuses are justified: Sangram
195.article_body: Indian wrestler Sangram Singh said that his girlfriend Payal Rohatgi is not being allowed to speak on show 'Lock Upp'. "Everyone [has] used or verbally attacked her...Poonam and Anjali abuse Payal...no one fires them. Kangana seems to agree that abuses are justified...This is very unfair...You're killing someone's self-confidence with such uncalled for behaviour," Sangram added.

196.title: Tamil Nadu to induct women as firefighters, proposal sent to government
196.article_body: Director General of Police and Director of the fire department in Tamil Nadu, Braj Kishore Ravi, said that the department has sent a proposal to the government for inducting women as firefighters in its Fire and Rescue Services department. He said that the services have 22 women officers but women firefighters have never been included in the department till now.

197.title: Duo blame 'forbidden' gold for daughter's illness, cheat woman of ₹2.50 lakh; 1 held
197.article_body: A man was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly cheating a woman of gold and cash worth ₹2.50 lakh on the pretext of curing her daughter's illness. The man, along with an aide, claimed the gold jewellery the woman's daughter was wearing was forbidden under Islamic law and was causing her illness. The accused then allegedly took it away for "cleansing".

198.title: Gang of six assaults youth with sharp weapons in Pune, one held
198.article_body: Six people have been booked for allegedly physically assaulting a youth with sharp weapons in Pune, police officials said. The victim, Sandesh Lahu Kadu (20), lodged an FIR at the Kothrud police station in which he alleged that the attackers assaulted him due to some personal enmity. One of them is arrested while the remaining five are in the hideout.

199.title: Grammarly, founded by Ukrainians, continues to pay staffers who joined Ukraine army
199.article_body: Typing assistant Grammarly, whose co-founders are Ukrainians, is continuing to pay full salaries and benefits to its Ukraine-based employees who joined the army to fight Russian forces, its CEO said. Before the war, nearly half of its 600 employees were based in Ukraine, however, many of them have now fled. "The team is...focused on their safety," CEO Brad Hoover added.

200.title: Muslim family donates land worth ₹2.5 crore in Bihar for world's largest Hindu temple
200.article_body: A Muslim family has donated land worth ₹2.5 crore for the construction of the world's largest Hindu temple, Virat Ramayan Mandir, in Bihar. Acharya Kishore Kunal, chief of the Patna-based Mahavir Mandir Trust, that has undertaken the project, said that Ishtiyaq Ahmad Khan, who has donated the land, is a businessman from East Champaran based in Guwahati.

201.title: Chemveda Life Sciences to invest ₹150 crore for expansion in Hyd
201.article_body: Research organisation Chemveda Life Sciences will invest ₹150 crore to add a state-of-the-art Research and Development centre in Hyderabad, Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao announced on Monday. This comes following a meeting between a delegation led by Rao and the organisation in US' San Diego the same day. The centre will create jobs for 500 scientists, Rao said.

202.title: Auto drivers protest in Pune over pending dues of COVID-19 relief fund
202.article_body: Auto drivers on Monday protested in Pune over pending dues of the COVID-19 relief fund earlier declared by the Maharashtra government. "As a relief, funds were been given by the state government and still, we have not yet received it," a rickshaw panchayat auto union convenor said. The auto drivers protested outside the Pune District Collector office.

203.title: Sushmita Sen, ex-boyfriend Rohman seen together for first time post-breakup, pics surface
203.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen and her ex-boyfriend Rohman Shawl were spotted together in Mumbai for the first time after their breakup in December last year. Sushmita's younger daughter Alisah Sen was also seen accompanying them. While announcing her breakup in December last year, Sushmita wrote on Instagram, "We began as friends, we remain friends!! The relationship was long over...the love remains!!"

204.title: Condition was I didn't have to mimic Rishi: Paresh on 'Sharmaji Namkeen'
204.article_body: Actor Paresh Rawal who will be seen playing the same role as late actor Rishi Kapoor in the movie 'Sharmaji Namkeen', said that the condition for him was to not mimic Rishi. "That wouldn't have done it. I had to hold on to his characteristics, his pain, the theme of the character and the focal point," he added.

205.title: UP's ex-minister Swati Singh moves plea to divorce legislator husband
205.article_body: Ex-Minister in the previous Yogi Adityanath's government, Swati Singh, has moved application seeking divorce from her husband. Swati was denied party ticket in the recently concluded UP Assembly polls while her husband Dayashankar Singh had contested as BJP candidate from Balia seat and won. Earlier, Swati alleged that Dayashankar has been conspiring against her to obtain party ticket for himself.

206.title: New Delhi-based Leverage Edu raises $22 mn, Kunal Shah invests too
206.article_body: New Delhi-based edtech platform ﻿Leverage Edu has raised $22 million in its Series B round of financing. The financing round values the startup at $120 million. The round also saw participation from UAE-based NB Ventures, 9Unicorns, Mankind Pharma, Trifecta Ventures and Bennett Coleman, among others. CRED﻿ founder Kunal Shah, ﻿BookMyShow﻿ founder Ashish Hemrajani also participated in the round.

207.title: Kohli told me he wanted to enjoy his cricket, RCB will give that to him: Irfan
207.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said Virat Kohli recently told him that he wanted to enjoy his cricket. Irfan added, "RCB will give him that kind of pleasure...he'll definitely be an on-field mentor...and I think he'll enjoy that role." Irfan further said, "When you're a captain you're looking after the result...Kohli won't have that kind of responsibility he'll love that."

208.title: TMC panchayat leader killed in bomb attack in West Bengal's Birbhum
208.article_body: Bhadu Sheikh, a TMC panchayat leader of Barshal village in the Rampurhat area of West Bengal's Birbhum, was killed in an alleged bomb attack on Monday evening, police said. According to witnesses, the victim was attacked by four men on motorcycles, who had their faces covered. The incident took place days after two councillors were shot dead in the state.

209.title: Aamir's Lagaan made big impression on me; country connected with it: Rajamouli
209.article_body: During RRR's promotional event, actor Aamir Khan asked director SS Rajamouli, "How do you connect with so many people across the country?" To this, Rajamouli replied, "The way the entire country connected with 'Lagaan' made a big impression on me. I learned from 'Lagaan' that if I make my story based on...human emotions, I have a chance to connect with...people."

210.title: Fire breaks out at SBI zonal office in Ranchi, documents burnt
210.article_body: A fire broke out on fourth floor of the State Bank of India's zonal office located in Kutchery Chowk, Ranchi, Jharkhand during the wee hours on Tuesday. Several documents and other items were reportedly burnt in the incident. The police and fire department were immediately informed about the matter. Fire tenders reached the spot and managed to douse the flames.

211.title: Hyderabad Police Commissioner felicitates 382 police personnel
211.article_body: Hyderabad Police organised a promotion-cum-pipping ceremony on Monday to felicitate newly promoted police personnel. A total of 382 personnel, who were recently promoted from the rank of Constable to Head Constable, were felicitated by City Police Commissioner CV Anand. He also lauded the efforts of the promotees for their swift detection and apprehension of criminals.

212.title: Gujarat govt withdraws 10 cases linked to 2015 Patidar quota agitation
212.article_body: Gujarat government has withdrawn 10 cases lodged in connection with the 2015 Patidar quota agitation, Public Prosecutor Sudhir Brahmbhatt said. Except for a sedition case against Hardik Patel, no case regarding the agitation is pending in sessions court in Ahmedabad, he added. The court allowed withdrawal of seven cases and a city metropolitan magistrate court allowed withdrawal of three cases.

213.title: Wanted gangster, named in about 33 cases, shot dead by UP police
213.article_body: Wanted gangster Manish Singh, who was named in about 33 cases and carried a reward of ₹2 lakh, was shot dead by UP police in an encounter in Varanasi on Monday. The Special Task Force said the encounter broke out when two motorcycle-borne men fired at them when asked to stop. Singh was shot when police returned fire.

214.title: Elderly woman cheated of ₹2 lakh-gold jewellery at Pune post office
214.article_body: A case has been filed after a 68-year-old woman was allegedly cheated of gold jewellery worth ₹2 lakh by a person in the premises of Pune's post office under the pretext of a scheme to get money. The accused reportedly took jewellery bag from the woman's seven-year-old grandson while she went to get her Aadhaar photocopied and fled, police said.

215.title: Bengaluru reports 53 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
215.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 53 new COVID-19 cases and one coronavirus-related death, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahangara Palike (BBMP). The city also reported 110 recoveries in the last 24 hours. The number of active cases in the city now stands at 1,648 with a positivity rate of 0.73%, the data showed.

216.title: Russia used hypersonic missile to detract from stalled invasion: UK
216.article_body: Russia's alleged use of its hypersonic missile is probably intended to "detract from a lack of progress" in its ground campaign in Ukraine, UK's Defence Ministry said. Deployment of Kinzhal hypersonic missiles is "highly unlikely to materially affect the outcome of Russia's campaign in Ukraine", it added. Russia had claimed it'd fired several hypersonic missiles against targets in western Ukraine.

217.title: Defence procurement was nil for 10 yrs under UPA-led govt: Sitharaman
217.article_body: Defence procurement under the UPA-led government was nil for 10 years, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. "I want to tell that 10 years of Indian defence history recorded nil purchases. Sir, 10 years were lost. After 2014, rapidly, we had to buy from pin to aircraft, everything," Sitharaman added during a debate in the Rajya Sabha.

218.title: Parliamentary panel examining raising marriageable age for women gets 3-month extension
218.article_body: The Parliamentary Standing Committee examining the proposed increase in legal age of marriage for women to 21 years has been granted a three-month extension by Rajya Sabha Chairman Venkaiah Naidu. The panel was expected to submit its findings on the Prohibition of Child Marriage (Amendment) Bill by March 24. Now it has to submit its report by June 24.

219.title: HP University VC files nomination as BJP candidate for Rajya Sabha poll
219.article_body: Himachal Pradesh University vice-chancellor Sikander Kumar on Monday filed his nomination as BJP candidate for election to the lone vacant seat in Rajya Sabha from the state. The election has been necessitated as Congress MP Anand Sharma will complete his term on April 2. Notably, two of the three Rajya Sabha seats from the state are occupied by BJP.

220.title: Officer shoots himself dead inside a police station in Assam
220.article_body: An ASI rank police officer allegedly shot himself dead inside a police station in the Cachar district of Assam on Monday. "ASI Gour Bidhu Singh shot himself on his head using his service pistol... inside Silchar Sadar Police Station," said Ramandeep Kaur, SP (Cachar). She added that the reason behind the alleged suicide is yet to be ascertained.

221.title: L'Oréal Professionnel Paris holds 4th Indian Hairdressing Awards
221.article_body: L’Oréal Professionnel Paris is hosting the Indian Hairdressing Awards, which the brand says is the biggest competition of professional hairstylists in the country. This year over 17,500 hairdressers across India competed for the title, it revealed. For the first time, the award ceremony will be broadcasted live and viewers from across the world can watch it online.

222.title: If GT does well, I might get chance to play for India in WT20: Shubman Gill
222.article_body: Gujarat Titans batter Shubman Gill, who's yet to feature for India in T20Is, has said if the franchise does well in IPL 2022, then he might be considered for the T20 World Cup later this year. "I'd love to [open]...but if the team wants me to do a different role, I'm game," he added. Shubman scored 478 runs last season.

223.title: Delhi HC to hear plea on removing anti-Ramdev video links on May 10
223.article_body: The Delhi High Court would hear on May 10, pleas by Facebook, Twitter and Google, challenging an order directing them to globally block or disable links to a video containing defamatory allegations against Ramdev. The defamatory video contained excerpts of a book on Ramdev named "Godman to Tycoon" which the High Court restrained from publishing in its September 2018 order.

224.title: NATO should openly say they're not accepting us as they're scared of Russia: Zelenskyy
224.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has claimed that the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) was afraid of Russia. "NATO should either say now that they're accepting us, or openly say that they are not accepting us as they are scared of Russia, which is true," The Kyiv Independent quoted Zelenskyy as saying, in an interview to Suspilne, a Ukrainian public broadcaster.

225.title: Cow vigilantes beat up van driver over 'carrying beef' in UP
225.article_body: A 35-year-old van driver was allegedly beaten up by cow vigilantes on suspicion of carrying beef and smuggling cattle in Raal village in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura. Villagers also assaulted two other self-proclaimed cow vigilantes, who enquired about the incident, after mistaking them as the driver's associates, police said. Videos of the incident purportedly show the driver being beaten with belts.

226.title: His dignity is humbling: Mahindra on 125-yr-old Padma Shri awardee Swami Sivananda
226.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared a video of UP-based yoga guru Swami Sivananda receiving the Padma Shri award and wrote, "The power of yoga. A life spanning 125 years of dedication." "The grace and dignity of...Sivananda is both humbling & inspiring. Proud to belong to the country of yoga's origin," he tweeted. Sivananda knelt before PM Narendra Modi at the ceremony.

227.title: All the emotions that came out on screen were real: The Kashmir Files actor
227.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher's niece, Vrinda Kher, who played the role of Bhawani Kaul, a Kashmiri Pandit in the film said the "gruesome" climax scene really shook her. The scene shows actor Bhasha Sumbli, playing the role of a displaced Kashmiri Pandit, Sharda Pandit, being stripped by terrorists in a migrant camp. She added, "All the emotions...came out on screen were...real."

228.title: I had suggested Jayalalithaa be taken abroad for treatment: O Panneerselvam
228.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister O Panneerselvam told an Inquiry Commission that he had suggested that former Chief Minister late J Jayalalithaa be taken abroad for her treatment. "Health Minister told me he would discuss possibility with Apollo Hospitals and later informed me Vijayakumar Reddy told him Jayalalithaa's health had improved and she could be discharged in week," Panneerselvam added.

229.title: Will not accept Russian ultimatums to end war: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
229.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Ukraine would never bow to "ultimatums from Russia" to end the war. The only way Russian forces can capture cities such as Mariupol, Kyiv or Kharkiv is to "kill everyone", he added. Zelenskyy insisted that a meeting with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin "in any format" is needed to end the war in Ukraine.

230.title: 18-year-old Hindu girl shot dead in Pakistan for resisting abduction: Reports
230.article_body: An 18-year-old Hindu girl was shot dead in Pakistan's Sindh province for resisting abduction, as per reports. The girl identified as Pooja Oad was said to have reportedly been shot dead in the middle of the street in Rohi, Sukkur. Every year, several women belonging to minority communities in Pakistan are abducted and forcibly converted by religious extremists, reports added.

231.title: Ex-J&K CM Omar Abdullah receives COVID vaccine certificates of 4 people
231.article_body: Jammu Kashmir National Conference Vice President and former CM of erstwhile J&K state Omar Abdullah tweeted that he received COVID-19 vaccination certificates of four people on his phone. "Dear Ashina, Kareem, Prashanth and Ameena. Congratulations for your first COVID-19 vaccine however I've no idea who you guys are and why you gave my mobile number for your certificates," Abdullah wrote.

232.title: South Africa once needed 22 off 13 balls, rain rule made it 21 off 1
232.article_body: South Africa needed 22 runs off 13 balls to win the World Cup semi-final against England on March 22, 1992 when rain stopped play. When the play resumed, South Africa's target was revised to 21 off 1 ball due to the rain rule, according to which reduction in target was proportionate to lowest-scoring overs of side batting first.

233.title: Train coach with 90 onboard derails at J'khand's Tatanagar station, none injured
233.article_body: The coach of a train with 90 people on board derailed at Tatanagar Junction railway station in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur on Monday, the Railways said. No one sustained injuries and all the passengers were later accommodated in alternative coaches, it added. The incident took place when the second-last coach of the Mumbai CSMT-Howrah Weekly Superfast Express derailed while entering the platform.

234.title: Alphabet's Waymo to remove safety drivers from self-driving cars in US
234.article_body: Google-parent Alphabet's self-driving tech unit Waymo said it is ready to remove safety drivers from its autonomous vehicles in San Francisco. In August, Waymo had started providing free autonomous rides to a limited number of people in San Francisco, with safety drivers on board. California earlier in March allowed Waymo to charge riders for trips with safety drivers.

235.title: Working with Prashant on bringing change in country: T'gana CM KCR
235.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday said that he's working with political strategist Prashant Kishor on bringing a "parivartan (change)" in the entire country. He called Kishor his "best friend" for the last seven and a half years, adding that he isn't a paid worker. "There's a vacuum in national politics. I'm pursuing national politics now," he further said.

236.title: Kashmiri Pandits got us food, 85-yr-old lady fed us: 'The Kashmir...' producer
236.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' producer Abhishek Agarwal said Kashmiri Pandits used to get food for team while they were shooting for the film. "I don't remember having relished food from outside. A lady who must have been about 85 years old would feed us food," he said, adding actor Anupam Kher and director Vivek Agnihotri would "shed tears" after every scene.

237.title: Been a long journey, I gave it all vs Viktor but it wasn't meant to be: Lakshya
237.article_body: India's 20-year-old shuttler Lakshya Sen has thanked his supporters and well-wishers after winning the silver at the All England Open Badminton Championships. "It's been a long journey from Almora to All England Open final. I gave it my all vs [world number one] Viktor Axelsen but it wasn't meant to be," he stated. Lakshya lost the final 10-21, 15-21.

238.title: Felt insulted that my report on farm laws only gathered dust: Anil Ghanwat
238.article_body: Farm leader Anil Ghanwat said that he "felt insulted" after his report, along with two others, on the now-repealed three farm laws gathered "dust for over a year". In a conversation with the Indian Express, Ghanwat said that he and other members of the SC-appointed committee "had put in serious efforts to compile the report during the challenging Covid-19 times".

239.title: Manoj Bajpayee is the biggest star in India today, not Salman: Shekhar Kapur
239.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur said Bollywood will be "completely shattered and unsuccessful if we try to tell the stories". "If you walk around in India today, who is the biggest star? It is not Salman Khan, it is Manoj Bajpayee...because everybody is shifting to OTT," added Shekhar. "We are arrogant enough to call ourselves storytellers...We provoke," stated Shekhar.

240.title: Delhi's Ashram underpass to open for traffic trials from today
240.article_body: Delhi's 750-metre-long Ashram underpass will be opened for traffic trials from Tuesday, three years after work began on the project, as per PWD officials. The underpass is built between the Nizamuddin railway bridge and CSIR Apartments which is Delhi's most critical and traffic-intensive stretches. This underpass project is reportedly one of the most delayed infrastructure projects in Delhi.

241.title: Doesn't matter if 32 or 50 people die after having spurious liquor In Bihar: JDU MLA
241.article_body: Janata Dal (United) MLA Gopal Mandal said, "It doesn’t matter if 32 people die or 50 after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar." Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has closed all liquor shops in the state long ago, Mandal added. "Senior police officers are connected to liquors smugglers for their personal benefits," Mandal stated.

242.title: India reports 1,581 new COVID-19 cases, 33 deaths in 24 hours
242.article_body: India has reported 1,581 new COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 33 deaths, 11 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 22 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,543, and the active cases declined to 23,913.

243.title: I wouldn't have made 'Runway 34' if Big B wouldn't have said yes: Ajay
243.article_body: Ajay Devgn said he was certain to cast Amitabh Bachchan for his film 'Runway 34' and had no other casting choice. "In this film, for Mr Bachchan's role, if he wouldn't have agreed, I don't even know if I would be able to cast (any other actor)." Speaking about Amitabh, Ajay said, "I haven't seen any other hardworking, professional actor."

244.title: Punjab man blames roommate for eviction from rented house, sets him on fire
244.article_body: A 27-year-old man was set on fire by his roommate, Aman, after the latter was evicted by landlord from a rented accommodation in Punjab. Aman blamed Raj for his eviction and set him on fire after pouring petrol on him on Sunday. Raj was taken to civil hospital where doctors said he suffered 55 per cent burns.

245.title: US declares Myanmar military committed genocide against Rohingyas
245.article_body: The United States has formally declared that Myanmar military committed genocide against Rohingya Muslims. "Members of the Burmese military committed genocide and crimes against humanity against Rohingyas," said US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. "Only seven times since the Holocaust has the US concluded that genocide was committed. Today, at the Holocaust Museum, marks the eighth," he added.

246.title: Raj's Kota imposes Sec 144 till April 21 in view of 'The Kashmir Files' screening
246.article_body: Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in Rajasthan's Kota from March 22 to April 21 in order to maintain law and order during screening of 'The Kashmir Files'. "Kota is highly vulnerable from communal point of view. Dharnas...due to the film, deaths of youth while bathing in Chambal river during upcoming festivals may affect...public order," an official order states.

247.title: I was sick, took medication, but I'm happy: Khawaja on 91 in Lahore Test
247.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja has revealed that he was a bit sick and was getting medication during the breaks in his 91-run innings against Pakistan in the ongoing Lahore Test. "I wasn't feeling well at all...[but] I just told myself, 'Just keep going, go as long as you can'...[and] I'm actually really happy with it," he stated.

248.title: Illegal firearms used in Prayagraj during Holi, police to conduct drive
248.article_body: Illegal firearms were found to have been used in two incidents during Holi in UP’s Prayagraj, which resulted in the death of four persons. Now, the police have decided to carry out a fresh drive against illegal weapons. The district police have arrested many persons with illegal firearms and ammunition, in the last few years.

249.title: Siddhant Chaturvedi mourns 24-year-old rapper MC Tod Fod's demise, shares Instagram chat
249.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi took to Instagram Stories to mourn the demise of 24-year-old rapper MC Tod Fod, who had featured in the film 'Gully Boy'. Sharing an Instagram chat from 2019, Siddhant wrote, "RIP bhai" and added a broken heart emoji. In the chat, Siddhant praised MC Tod Fod for the song 'India 91'.

250.title: No survivors found in crash of Chinese plane carrying 132 people
250.article_body: No survivors have been found as the search continued of the scattered wreckage of a China Eastern plane carrying 132 people that crashed on Monday. "Wreckage of the plane was found at the scene, but up until now, none of those aboard the plane with whom contact was lost have been found," state broadcaster CCTV said.

251.title: Nationalism infused in J&K post abrogation of Article 370: Kailash Vijayvargiya
251.article_body: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya on Monday said that the social and political ecosystem of Jammu and Kashmir is being improved post the abrogation of Article 370. "The sense of nationalism has been infused in the hearts of the people of Jammu and Kashmir by the government," said Vijayvargiya before watching the movie 'The Kashmir Files'.

252.title: Former PRO to Odisha Governor, CM arrested in murder case
252.article_body: A retired civil servant from Odisha Niranjan Sethi, who had served as public relation officer (PRO) to a former Governor and former Chief Minister, was arrested in connection with the murder of a cameraman of a web channel, police said. "The victim was killed over a purported sex scandal videotape that includes...politicians and police officers," Jatin Panda, ASP Bhadrak, added.

253.title: Spent sleepless nights over ₹16 lakh down payment: Anil Agarwal on buying his 1st firm
253.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Monday shared how he acquired a bankrupt company named Shamsher Sterling Cable Company in May 1976. "I had no experience on how to buy a company, but I went ahead anyway," he wrote. Agarwal revealed that he "spent many sleepless nights thinking" about the down payment but managed to gather ₹16 lakh through loans.

254.title: Was told I'm a 'gas tanker': Raashii Khanna on bullying in film industry
254.article_body: 'Rudra: The Edge of Darkness' actress Raashii Khanna, while talking about criticism she has faced in the industry, said that she was called a "gas tanker". "I don't say anything because I was quite big for the mainstream that they have. And I did become fitter in time, not to please anybody...So I've faced all that bullying," Raashii added.

255.title: Harden cyber defences: Biden warns of Russian cyberattacks on US companies
255.article_body: US President Joe Biden has urged American companies to "harden" their cyber defences "immediately" amid "evolving intelligence" that Russia could target American firms and critical infrastructure with cyberattacks in response to US sanctions over Ukraine invasion. "The magnitude of Russia's cyber capacity is fairly consequential, and...the...government is doing its part to get ready," Biden added.

256.title: Imran Khan! Your game is over, Shehbaz Sharif to be PM candidate: Maryam Nawaz
256.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz has said that her party, PML-N, will nominate Shehbaz Sharif, her uncle, as PM candidate if incumbent Imran Khan fails to pass no-confidence motion. "Imran Khan! Your game is over. The Prime Minister is aware that no one will come to his rescue now that he has lost the game," she said.

257.title: India has been somewhat shaky in terms of dealing with Putin's aggression: Biden
257.article_body: US President Joe Biden said that India has been somewhat shaky in terms of dealing with Russian President Vladimir Putin's aggression against Ukraine. "[In the Quad], Japan has been extremely strong, so has Australia," he added. Biden further asserted that Putin didn't anticipate how unified NATO and western allies would be in a global response to his invasion of Ukraine.

258.title: Tumakuru bus accident survivors seek concessions in upcoming exams
258.article_body: Several students who got injured in the recent bus accident in Tumakuru have sought concessions in the upcoming examinations. "Our preparations were affected by the accident and the subsequent treatment," said one of the eight injured students. "We have asked the officials who visited us to ask the government to give us concessions with regard to the examinations," said students.

259.title: BJP MP calls Gadkari 'Spiderman', says he's 'built web of roads'
259.article_body: BJP MP Tapir Gao on Monday called Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari a "Spiderman". He said that like a spider, Gadkari has built a "web of roads in every corner of this country". Gao said this in Lok Sabha while participating in a debate on the demands for grants of the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways.

260.title: Traffic to be disrupted for 10 hrs on Delhi-Gurugram Expressway tomorrow
260.article_body: Traffic on the Delhi-Gurugram Expressway is likely to be disrupted for nearly 10 hours on Wednesday as the highway will be closed for traffic from 7am to 5pm, the Gurugram traffic police said. The highway will be closed due to a proposed march in support of the demand for the creation of an Ahir regiment in the Indian Army.

261.title: I went back to my playing days as captain during auction: LSG mentor Gambhir
261.article_body: LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir has revealed that he went back to playing days as captain to gauge what their captain KL Rahul would feel about the players they were investing in during the IPL mega auction. "I was trying to think like the captain...[to] understand what KL would have felt," Gambhir stated. LSG will face GT on March 28.

262.title: Pune temple decorated with 2,000 kg grapes for Sankashti Chaturthi
262.article_body: Pictures of Pune's Dagadusheth Halwai Ganpati temple decorated with 2,000 kg grapes on the occasion of Sankashti Chaturthi has surfaced online. The grapes used for the decoration were grown by Nashik's Sahyadri Farmers Producer Company, the temple's trust said. A member of the farmers' company said that the grapes will be distributed to various NGOs and hospitals as 'prasada'.

263.title: 17-year-old drowns in Pune Municipal Corporation swimming pool
263.article_body: A 17-year-old boy drowned in a swimming pool run by Pune Municipal Corporation in Wanwadi on Sunday, police said. The deceased had gone to the pool with friends, police added. The others came out of the pool due to alleged impure water but the victim could not be found. He was later found in an unconscious state, police stated.

264.title: Case registered against Mumbai firm for cheating Axis Bank of ₹42.5 crore
264.article_body: Mumbai Police has registered a loan fraud case against a private firm for allegedly cheating Axis Bank of ₹42.5 crore. Police said the firm allegedly availed cash credit facility from the bank, but failed to repay it. Forensic auditing of the firm's accounts revealed that it used the money for purposes other than what it had claimed while availing loan.

265.title: Hyderabad Police launch fitness drive for city police personnel
265.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand on Monday launched a 'Health and Fitness' programme for the city police personnel. The drive, launched in collaboration with NGO Helping Hand Foundation, will help promote fitness among 17,500 police staff. The programme is designed on WHO-recommended protocols and will have three components- screening, counselling and fitness.

266.title: Cleartrip 'Big Travel Sale' offers discounts on flights & hotels
266.article_body: Travel booking platform, Cleartrip has come up with 'Big Travel Sale' starting 22nd March. The campaign features celebrities like Shruti Haasan, Ravi Shastri, Mithila Palkar, and Dhruv Sehgal. Travellers can avail flat 25% off* on domestic hotels, flat 12% off* on domestic flights, and up to 15% off* on international flights. The sale ends on 31st March.

267.title: DRDO scientist held in Rohini blast case was inspired by shootout: Police
267.article_body: A 47-year-old DRDO scientist Bharat Bhushan Kataria, arrested in December 2021, in Rohini blast case was "inspired" by Rohini courtroom shootout in which three gangsters were killed, Delhi Police Special Cell said. He was held for allegedly planting a bomb in a tiffin carrier in Rohini court complex. Kataria allegedly wanted to take revenge on his neighbour, the chargesheet claims.

268.title: Cardiologist sacked after deaths of 3 patients at Delhi's Rajiv Gandhi hospital
268.article_body: An associate professor of cardiology, working on contractual basis at Delhi's Rajiv Gandhi Super Speciality Hospital, was sacked after three patients with heart blockage died earlier this month, following Delhi Secretariat's orders. A committee, that was set up to review matter, is investigating allegations of medical negligence. Doctors earlier claimed two patients died before stents were placed.

269.title: OneWeb to launch satellites with SpaceX after suspending ties with Russia
269.article_body: Bharti Global and the UK co-owned OneWeb has agreed to launch its satellites with Elon Musk's SpaceX after it suspended ties with Russia's Roscosmos. This comes weeks after Russia cancelled a OneWeb launch from its Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan. The satellite firm, whose total in-orbit constellation currently stands at 428 satellites, expects its first launch with SpaceX in 2022.

270.title: BMC to install 28 floodgates at Mithi river to prevent monsoon flooding
270.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to install 28 floodgates at Mithi river to avoid flooding during monsoon season. Officials said the floodgates will prevent overflowing water from entering the residential areas and railway tracks. "We don't have adequate space to set up horizontal floodgates...we have decided to set up vertical gates that will use less space," an official said.

271.title: Man kills neighbour for assaulting his pet dog in Ghaziabad
271.article_body: A 27-year-old man was allegedly murdered for assaulting his neighbour’s pet dog in Ghaziabad's Indirapuram area. The deceased was identified as Mohammad Mustaqeem and his neighbour as Chatar Singh. "My brother assaulted Chatar Singh's pet dog when the dog attacked him...During the fight, Chatar Singh pulled out a pair of scissors and attacked my brother," Mustaqeem's brother said.

272.title: Ugandan woman, 1 other arrested with ₹8 lakh mephedrone in Goregaon
272.article_body: The Anti-Narcotics Cell on Sunday arrested two persons including a woman from Uganda and recovered the drug mephedrone worth ₹8.20 lakh from their possession in Mumbai's Goregaon. According to the police, the 28-year-old Ugandan woman, Babire Grace, came to India in 2019 on a tourist visa. Officials are now trying to trace the source of narcotic drugs and their customers.

273.title: Angry about being denied lift back home, man stabs friend in Mumbai; held
273.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a man, Bhavin Kolekar, for attacking and seriously injuring his 26-year-old friend who allegedly refused to drop him home. Kolekar attacked his friend with a sharp object. "The accused is a habitual drinker and a jobless man, he attacked his friend out of jealousy, as the victim is employed and earns money," police said.

274.title: Domestic LPG cylinder price hiked by ₹50 for 1st time since October
274.article_body: The price of a domestic LPG cylinder has been increased by around ₹50 in Delhi, Mumbai and other cities, the first hike since October 6, 2021. A 14.2 kg cylinder now costs ₹949.50 in Delhi and Mumbai as against ₹899.50 earlier, while in Kolkata, it costs ₹976. On Tuesday, petrol price was also hiked for the first time since November.

275.title: Rapper MC Tod Fod, who featured in 'Gully Boy', passes away aged 24
275.article_body: Rapper Dharmesh Parmar aka MC Tod Fod, who featured in Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Gully Boy', has passed away aged 24. He was associated with the multilingual group Swadesi. The cause of his death is not known yet. Ranveer took to Instagram Stories to share a picture of MC Tod Fod and shared a broken heart emoji.

276.title: Petrol, diesel prices raised by 80 paise per litre after a gap of over 4 months
276.article_body: Petrol and diesel prices have been increased by 80 paise per litre for the first time in over four months. The rate of petrol in the country's capital Delhi is ₹96.21 per litre today while that of diesel is ₹87.47 per litre. In Mumbai, the petrol and diesel prices have increased to ₹110.82 per litre and ₹95.00 per litre respectively.

277.title: 14-yr-old girl dies after being hit by garbage truck in Bengaluru
277.article_body: A 14-year-old girl, identified as Akshaya, died after being hit by a BBMP garbage truck on Bengaluru's airport road on Monday. The victim, a Class 9 student, was reportedly trying to cross the busy road as she avoided taking the underpass which was waterlogged due to rain. Four of her friends managed to cross the road safely, said police.

278.title: Hyderabad police arrest 2 drug peddlers, seize 1.2 kg ganja
278.article_body: Hyderabad City Police have said that they arrested two alleged drug peddlers on Monday and seized 1.2 kg ganja, two phones and an auto worth a total of ₹40,000. The accused were arrested red-handed while they were waiting to sell the ganja to customers in the Mangalhat area, police added. The accused are aged 35 and 38, police further said.

279.title: 2 killed in knife attack at Swedish school; student arrested
279.article_body: Two women in their 50s have been killed following a knife attack at a Swedish school on Monday, police said. An 18-year-old man, who is a student at the school, has been arrested on suspicion of murder. Around 50 people were reportedly at the school when the incident took place, all of whom were evacuated from the building.

280.title: CBI seizes ₹28 lakh cash in raids on Senior Intelligence Officer
280.article_body: The CBI on Monday recovered around ₹28 lakh cash and incriminating documents from the premises of a Senior Intelligence Officer after conducting searches at several locations. The searches were said to have been conducted at five locations at the premises situated in Delhi, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh. They were held in connection with a bribery case against the accused.

281.title: WB introduces new govt school uniform with 'Biswa Bangla' logo
281.article_body: The TMC-led West Bengal government has introduced a common blue-and-white uniform featuring the 'Biswa Bangla' logo in all state-run schools. According to the notification, the Department of MSME and Textiles will be supplying the new uniforms. However, the move has garnered some criticism with a lawyer filing public interest litigation in Calcutta High Court against the use of the logo.

282.title: Past 5 yrs saw disconnect between people of Punjab, govt: Governor
282.article_body: The past five years saw a serious disconnect between the people of Punjab and the government as they considered themselves "masters" and the public their "servile subjects," said Governor Banwarilal Purohit on Monday. He also highlighted Aam Aadmi Party's plan for the next five years, adding that the party has a "zero-tolerance policy towards corruption."

283.title: Signs of emerging narco-terror from across western borders: Govt
283.article_body: Minister of State for Defence Ajay Bhatt on Monday said that the situation along the western borders remains stable, but there are signs of emerging narco-terror from across the border. He further said that the situation along the Line of Control (LoC) remains stable post the Understanding of February 2021 between Director Generals of Military Operations of India and Pakistan.

284.title: Agencies running under BJP dictatorship: Abhishek on ED probe
284.article_body: TMC MP and Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee has claimed that investigating agencies are functioning under BJP's dictatorship. His statement came after he was questioned by Enforcement Directorate (ED) for eight hours over the coal scam in West Bengal. "Since they're failing to take on TMC democratically, they're using...central agencies to scare the opposition," Banerjee added.

285.title: MP officials destroy illegal opium poppy cultivation in Rajasthan
285.article_body: An illegal opium poppy cultivation in Rajasthan's Bundi district has been destroyed by officials of the Madhya Pradesh unit of Central Bureau of Narcotics. The team, on the basis of specific intelligence information, raided the field where opium was being grown in an area measuring around 673 square metre. They, subsequently, destroyed the plants using a rotavator after taking samples.

286.title: UP man beats wife for voting against his choice, NCW seeks action
286.article_body: A Muslim woman from UP's Bareilly was allegedly beaten by her husband and thrown out of her matrimonial house for voting against his choice of political party. The NCW took cognisance of the incident and said the woman was reportedly also threatened with divorce. NCW chairperson Rekha Sharma has written to UP DGP to take action against the accused.

287.title: Over-speeding SUV kills hawker, injures several in Chhattisgarh
287.article_body: An intoxicated man driving an over-speeding SUV in Chhattisgarh's Raipur killed a roadside hawker and hit several people. Police said the hit-and-run incident, that took place late on Sunday night, also seriously injured three men on the roads of Budhapara, Purani Basti police station limits. The man, identified as Devraj Pal, was arrested by police.

288.title: Civilian shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam
288.article_body: A civilian was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam district, the police informed on Monday. The area's police force said that the victim, identified as Tajamul Mohiuddin Rather, was injured after being fired upon by militants at his house in Gotpora village. In another incident, a non-local was attacked by militants in Pulwama district and left injured.

289.title: Cabinet approves extension of National AIDS Programme till 2026
289.article_body: The Union Cabinet chaired by PM Narendra Modi has approved the continuation of the National AIDS Control Programme till March 31, 2026. The Health Ministry said on Monday that it has a budget of around ₹15,500 crore. The programme, which is currently in its fifth phase, is fully funded by the Government of India.

290.title: Hope wisdom prevails in future: Tharoor as Sonia denies permission for CPI(M) event
290.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said he pulled out of a CPI(M) event after party chief Sonia Gandhi denied him permission to attend it. Stressing on the need to follow procedures in such issues, Tharoor said, "I regret that some preferred the unseemly airing of internal differences, thereby creating a needless controversy...I hope wisdom will prevail in the future."

291.title: Apple's iMessage, Music, Maps, other services down for users globally
291.article_body: Apple's several services appeared to be experiencing outages globally on Monday. As per Downdetector, users were reporting issues with Apple Music, Apple Maps, iCloud, the App Store, iMessage, and Apple TV. In India, users from Delhi, Bengaluru, and Mumbai were reporting issues with Apple's services. Apple's System Status page is currently showing that all services are operating normally.

292.title: Uttarakhand will make rapid progress under Dhami: Rajnath Singh
292.article_body: Defence Minister and senior BJP leader Rajnath Singh congratulated Pushkar Singh Dhami on being chosen as Uttarakhand Chief Minister on Monday. While talking to media outside the party's office in Dehradun, he said, "I'm confident that under his leadership Uttarakhand will make rapid progress." Dhami will be taking over the reins of the state for the second time.

293.title: S Phangnon Konyak to be Nagaland's first woman Rajya Sabha MP
293.article_body: BJP leader S Phangnon Konyak is set to become the first woman Rajya Sabha MP from Nagaland after winning the Rajya Sabha seat on Monday. "Women comprise 50% of the electorate. While Naga women have been very actively involved in politics, they haven't been forthcoming to contest the elections," she said. Konyak is the second Naga woman parliamentarian.

294.title: Indian startups are disrupting the world: NITI Aayog CEO
294.article_body: Indian startups are disrupting the world, especially in new emerging areas of health, nutrition and agriculture, according to NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant. He said women-owned businesses and enterprises are playing a very prominent role in society and will soon be the next big disruption. India at present has over 61,000 startups and 81 unicorns, he added.

295.title: Russia halts peace treaty talks with Japan over sanctions
295.article_body: The Russian Foreign Ministry on Monday said that Russia has decided to withdraw from peace treaty talks with Japan in response to sanctions imposed by the Japanese government over the conflict in Ukraine. It also accused Japan of "consciously choosing an anti-Russian course". Japan claims four Russian-controlled islands as its own in a dispute dating back to World War II.

296.title: Akhilesh alleges irregularities in vote counting during UP polls
296.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged that there were irregularities in counting of votes during the Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls. He said that the SP candidate from Varanasi South was leading till 20 rounds of counting. However, counting of votes was suddenly stopped and some time later, BJP's Neelkanth Tiwari, a minister, was declared the winner, he added.

297.title: 3 workers missing after blast at dynamite factory in Greece
297.article_body: Three workers were reported missing following an explosion at a dynamite factory in northern Greece, authorities said on Monday. "This...explosion...was detected dozens of kilometres away," the regional governor, Giorgos Kasapidis, said. "Explosives experts and rescue specialists are on the way to secure the site and make sure there are no secondary consequences from the...explosion," he added.

298.title: 10-minute gamble with worker's life: Karti on Zomato's 10-minute delivery service
298.article_body: Congress MP Karti P Chidambaram on Monday criticised Zomato's upcoming 10-minute food delivery service 'Zomato Instant' and tweeted, "This is a ten-minute-long gamble with a gig worker's life." He also tweeted, "This is absurd! It's going to put undue pressure on the delivery personnel, who are not employees & who have no benefits or security or bargaining power with Zomato."

299.title: More than 25% crowd likely to be allowed in stadiums for IPL 2022: Reports
299.article_body: IPL 2022 will reportedly have more than 25% of the capacity crowds at the venues. The tournament will be held from March 26 to May 29 across four venues in two cities of Maharashtra, Mumbai and Pune. It has also been reported that going ahead the stadiums will have more fans than the initial matches.

300.title: Abhishek being harassed by Centre: TMC as ED questions him
300.article_body: After TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee was questioned by Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case linked to Bengal coal scam on Monday, party spokesperson Kunal Ghosh claimed Banerjee is being harassed by the union government. BJP is controlling agencies like CBI and ED, Ghosh said. He also asked why BJP's Suvendu Adhikari wasn't questioned in cases he was named in.

301.title: Don't trouble me for interviews, hard work must be silent: Pradeep to media
301.article_body: Pradeep Mehra whose video went viral has said he's being troubled by the media for interviews, adding, "It seems like I ran a few steps and I'm being praised so much, I won't be able to focus on my goal." The 19-year-old appealed to the media to not approach him, adding, "Hard work must be silent, success must be celebrated."

302.title: It cost me 8 years of mega back pain: Musk on old pic of himself sumo wrestling
302.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday took to Twitter to share an old picture of himself sumo wrestling. "Managed to throw him, but it cost me smashing my c5-c6 disc & 8 years of mega back pain! Finally fixed with c5-c6 disc fusion," Musk tweeted. Musk had earlier challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to a "single combat" for Ukraine.

303.title: Tried to pitch it up to dismiss Aus batters: Shaheen on Day 1 of 3rd Test
303.article_body: Having reduced Australia to 8/2 after three overs on Day 1 of third Test against Pakistan, Pakistan pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi said he tried to pitch the ball up in right areas to dismiss opposition batters. He added that there are many chances of getting a wicket in morning session of a Test. Shaheen dismissed David Warner and Marnus Labuschagne.

304.title: Virat Kohli joins RCB bio-bubble ahead of IPL 2022, RCB share pics
304.article_body: Former RCB captain Virat Kohli joined the team bio-bubble ahead of IPL 2022. RCB took to social media to share pictures of Kohli, writing, "King Kohli has arrived! That's it. That's the news." RCB will face PBKS in their IPL 2022 opener on March 27 at DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai. RCB will be led by Faf Du Plessis.

305.title: Who is Swami Sivananda, the 125-yr-old yoga guru awarded the Padma Shri?
305.article_body: Born in 1896, in Sylhet district (now in Bangladesh), Swami Sivananda practices yoga every day and eats food without oil and spices. For the last 50 years, he has been serving 400-600 leprosy-affected beggars by arranging food, clothes and other essentials for them in Puri. In an earlier interview, he said he owed his age to "yoga, discipline and celibacy".

306.title: US sanctions Sudan's police force over crackdown on protesters
306.article_body: US has placed sanctions on Sudan's Central Reserve Police, accusing it of using excessive force on anti-coup demonstrators who've been protesting against the country's military coup since October last year. "We condemn Sudan’s security services for killing, harassing, and intimidating [people]," US Treasury Department said in a statement. Over 80 people have reportedly died in protests since coup.

307.title: Portugal's Sao Jorge island hit by 90 small earthquakes in 24 hrs
307.article_body: Authorities in Portugal's Azores archipelago have said that the mid-Atlantic volcanic island of Sao Jorge was hit by nearly 90 small earthquakes in a little over 24 hours. The Azores Civil Protection authority has asked local mayors and fire units to "remain vigilant". The authority has requested an evaluation by experts from the region's volcanic surveillance centre.

308.title: Brazil Vice Prez Mourão won't be my running mate this time: Bolsonaro
308.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Monday that Vice President General Hamilton Mourão won't be his running mate in the October general elections. Bolsonaro, who will seek a second term, stated that his running mate choice will be announced formally in April. "I need a vice president that does not have the ambition of sitting in my chair," he added.

309.title: US cannot confirm Russia's use of hypersonic missiles: US official
309.article_body: A senior US defence official on Monday said the US cannot independently confirm or refute Russia's recent claim that it had used hypersonic Kinzhal missiles in Ukraine. "It could be that they're trying to send a message to the West," the official added. Russia had claimed that it had used the missiles to destroy a weapons depot in Ivano-Frankivsk region.

310.title: DC used excuse to cast non-Egyptians in 'Black Adam': Mohamed Diab
310.article_body: Mohamed Diab, the director of Marvel Studios' show 'Moon Knight', revealed he was "annoyed" with DC for creating a fictional middle eastern country as an excuse to cast non-Egyptians in 'Black Adam'. "It was...meant to be in Egypt," he added. Diab said, "It's not a full mistake since it's based on an iteration of the comics that doesn't mention Egypt."

311.title: Loyalty must be considered while naming Punjab Cong chief: Bajwa
311.article_body: Punjab Congress leader Pratap Singh Bajwa on Monday said that the appointment of the next state party chief should be based on loyalty, seniority and capability. "I leave everything to the party's high command, three factors need to be looked after," he added. Bajwa submitted his resignation as a Rajya Sabha member after being elected to the Punjab Assembly.

312.title: Indian economy better placed to deal with challenges: RBI Governor
312.article_body: Governor of the Reserve Bank of India, Shaktikanta Das on Monday said that the Indian economy is "comfortably placed to deal with any challenges with regard to financing the Current Account Deficit (CAD)". He also said that the RBI will continue to ensure liquidity to support the economy, which is facing some troubles following the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

313.title: ₹5,000 cash for those who help road accident victims in TN: CM
313.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Monday said that people who will help provide medical care facilities to road accident victims in the state will be given a cash reward of ₹5,000. CM Stalin had earlier launched 'Innuyir Kaappon', a scheme providing free medical treatment within the first 48 hours to those injured in road accidents.

314.title: The journey made me better: Rubina on marital issues with Abhinav
314.article_body: Television actress Rubina Dilaik, speaking about her marital issues with husband actor Abhinav Shukla, said that the journey made her a better person. The couple had earlier spoken about facing tough times and contemplating divorce on 'Bigg Boss 14'. "Being on the biggest reality show, we gave...access to people to judge us and also peek into our lives," she added.

315.title: Growth impact of Ukraine crisis should be marginal for India: RBI Governor
315.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor, Shaktikanta Das, on Monday said the growth impact of the Russia-Ukraine crisis should be marginal for India. He further said he does not see a situation in India where inflation remains above the 2% to 6% band for extended period. Das was addressing industrialists at the National Council Meeting of the CII.

316.title: Warner has shown greatness, will have point to prove in IPL 2022: Karthik
316.article_body: Picking David Warner as the player to watch out for in upcoming IPL, Dinesh Karthik said the DC batter has shown greatness in IPL over a period of time. He added that Warner will have a "point to prove" as his last year with SRH didn't go according to plan. Notably, the Australian opener is fifth-highest run-scorer in IPL history.

317.title: Suspected attackers kill at least 13 soldiers in Burkina Faso: Army
317.article_body: Burkina Faso military on Monday said suspected Islamic militants killed at least 13 soldiers and injured eight others in Burkina Faso's eastern Gourma province on March 20. The army added that a number of armed attackers were killed in the incident. This comes as the army has been conducting large-scale operations to regain territories that were lost to the militants.

318.title: India managed Omicron variant 23 times better than other countries: Govt
318.article_body: Health Ministry’s Lav Agarwal on Monday said that India managed the COVID-19 Omicron variant "23 times better" as compared to other countries in the world. He added, "We gave QR coded digital certificates to every citizen for every COVID-19 dose delivered. We have not leveraged technology, we have leveraged human resources in this country, which worked with commitment."

319.title: India puts Boeing 737 fleets under 'enhanced surveillance' after China plane crash
319.article_body: After a Boeing 737 aircraft of China Eastern Airlines carrying 132 passengers crashed in Guangxi on Monday, India's civil aviation regulator placed the Boeing 737 fleets of Indian carriers under "enhanced surveillance". DGCA chief said the authority was taking "a number of initiatives" after the tragedy. SpiceJet, Vistara and Air India Express have Boeing 737 aircraft in their fleets.

320.title: Employees' PF interest rate cut reflects today's realities: Nirmala Sitharaman
320.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke about the lowering of interest on the Employees' Provident Fund from 8.5% to 8.1% for 2021-22. She said, "EPFO's central board has representatives from different stakeholders who have taken this call...It had been 40 years since the rate wasn't brought down." She added, "There are today's realities that keep us in context with the decisions."

321.title: Loved 'Badhaai Do', an important story told brilliantly: Samantha
321.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu has praised Bhumi Pednekar and Rajkummar Rao-starrer 'Badhaai Do'. Taking to Instagram Stories on Monday, she wrote, "Absolutely loved Badhaai Do. An important story told brilliantly with outstanding performances." In the film, Bhumi played a lesbian physical education teacher, whereas, Rajkummar played the role of a gay policeman. "Love is love," Samantha added.

322.title: Guj shopkeeper who consumed acid after killing 17-yr-old girl dies
322.article_body: A 21-year-old shopkeeper, who allegedly strangled a 17-year-old girl to death in a Gujarat hotel before consuming acid, has died in hospital, police said on Monday. The two were reportedly in a relationship and had checked into the hotel before the incident. The investigation is still on and forensic report to ascertain cause of girl's death is awaited, police said.

323.title: I said counsel him, not cancel him: Trevor after Kanye's attack on him
323.article_body: Television talk show host Trevor Noah on Sunday tweeted, "I said counsel Kanye, not cancel Kanye." This comes after rapper Kanye West was barred from performing at the Grammy Awards 2022 due to his "concerning online behaviour". Kanye had directed a racial attack on Trevor after he criticised the rapper saying that he was harassing his ex-wife Kim Kardashian.

324.title: I see leadership qualities in all: Shreyas in first address as KKR captain
324.article_body: Giving his introductory speech as KKR skipper ahead of IPL 2022, Shreyas Iyer said he sees the leadership qualities in each and every player of the team. "We need to care for each other as a team because there will be tough times...let us try and create that formidable relationship on and off...field and propel on the field," he stated.

325.title: Crypto mining cost not to be allowed as deduction under Income Tax Act: Govt
325.article_body: The infrastructure cost incurred in the mining of cryptocurrencies or any Virtual Digital Assets (VDA) won't be allowed as a deduction under the Income Tax Act, MoS for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said. He said the government will come out with a definition of VDA with a view to levy 30% tax on income from the transfer of such assets.

326.title: 190 industries polluting Ganga shut down, 165 not complying: Govt
326.article_body: Minister of State for Jal Shakti Bishweswar Tudu on Monday said that out of the 1,080 industries causing pollution in Ganga, 190 have been closed while 165 are still not complying with norms. About 280.17 million litres per day (MLD) effluents are being discharged into river Ganga main stem having a BOD load of 9.68 tons per day, Tudu added.

327.title: A producer once said 'Do you think you're Madhuri Dixit?': Gauahar
327.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan has revealed that a producer once told her, "Tumhe kya lagta hai, tum Madhuri Dixit ho (What do you think, you are Madhuri Dixit)?" The actress further said that another producer took her date of birth and called ten days later to say, "You'll never become an actress...If you do, you'll only do shady and sidey roles."

328.title: 'The Kashmir Files' creating situation that may harm India: Yechury
328.article_body: Reacting to 'The Kashmir Files', CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury said the film is creating a situation that may cause "great harm" to India's social unity and integrity. Yechury added that his party was the first to speak out against the plight of Kashmiri Pandits in 1990, with its MLAs addressing the issue in the former Jammu and Kashmir Legislative Assembly.

329.title: Cong doesn't politicise religion or caste: Kharge on Azad's remark
329.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said on Monday that the party doesn't engage in politicising religion or caste and added that no other party should do it either. Kharge's remark came a day after fellow Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said that all parties divide people on a religious and caste basis, which Kharge has termed Azad's "personal view".

330.title: Two trains collide in Tunisian capital, 95 people injured: Govt
330.article_body: Tunisian authorities on Monday said 95 people were injured as two trains collided in capital Tunis. Civil Defence Spokesman Moez Triaa said the injured were rushed to hospital and that no deaths occurred during the accident. He added that only one train carried passengers. In 2016, at least five people were killed after a train slammed into a public bus.

331.title: It's going to top the first one: Angela Bassett on 'Black Panther 2'
331.article_body: Actress Angela Bassett, speaking about her upcoming film 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever', has said, "It's going to be amazing. It's going to top [the first] one." Angela remembered late actor Chadwick Boseman, who played the lead in the 2018 film 'Black Panther' and called him a leader and an amazing talent. "We just hope to raise his standard," she added.

332.title: I search for films to direct which aren't easy to mount: Ajay Devgn
332.article_body: Talking about directing films, Ajay Devgn said, "When I want to make a film, I search for films which are not easy to mount." Ajay further stated creating new visuals for his upcoming film 'Runway 34' was difficult as the film is set on the ground and air. "It was also exciting," he added. The film also stars Amitabh Bachchan.

333.title: Hardik is a very interesting choice: Karthik on GT captain
333.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said he's keen to see how new franchise Gujarat Titans perform in upcoming IPL, calling their captain Hardik Pandya an "interesting choice". He added that Hardik has all the "flamboyance" and it remains to be seen whether he can transfer that into his teammates. "He's going to be in a good nick," Karthik further said.

334.title: No proposal to increase funds allocated under MPLAD Scheme: Govt
334.article_body: There is no proposal to increase the funds allocated to each MP under the Members of Parliament Local Area Development (MPLAD) Scheme, the Centre informed the Rajya Sabha on Monday. Union Minister of State Rao Inderjit Singh made the announcement in a written reply to a query raised by Kerala Congress (M) MP Jose K Mani.

335.title: Joined military school at 18, was taught how to seduce targets: Ex-Russian spy
335.article_body: A 37-year-old woman revealed that she was a former Russian spy who was taught how to seduce and manipulate targets at a military school that she had joined at the age of 18. Speaking about the Ukraine war, Aliia Roza said Russian President Vladimir Putin "will go till the end". Roza now lives in the US and works in PR.

336.title: SBSP on wrong track with Samajwadi Party: BJP leader
336.article_body: UP BJP Vice President Daya Shankar Singh said Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) is on the "wrong track" with the Samajwadi Party. He added that only BJP can help SBSP achieve its goals. Singh also said SBSP chief OP Rajbhar has been raising issues of the most backward communities and BJP works for taking the weaker sections ahead.

337.title: Putin's 'lover' hiding with their secret kids in Swiss villa, says online petition
337.article_body: A petition on change.org has sought the expulsion of former Russian gymnast Alina Kabaeva from Switzerland, amid Ukraine's invasion. The petition alleged that the 38-year-old is a lover of Russian President Vladimir Putin and is 'hiding' with their 'secret children' in a luxury villa. "Despite the current war, Switzerland continues to host an accomplice of Putin's regime," said the petition.

338.title: At least 925 civilians killed, 1,496 injured in Ukraine: UN
338.article_body: Office of UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Monday said at least 925 civilians were killed in Ukraine as of midnight on March 20 since Russia invaded Ukraine. The office added that most of the fatalities were from heavy artillery shelling, multiple-launch rocket systems, missiles and airstrikes. However, OHCHR said the actual death toll might be considerably higher.

339.title: Pakistan win a Women's World Cup game for the first time since 2009
339.article_body: Pakistan defeated West Indies today to win a match in Women's World Cup for the first time since 2009. Before this match, Pakistan had lost 18 matches in a row in Women's World Cups. The match was reduced to 20 overs per side, with West Indies putting up a total of 89/7. Pakistan chased down the target in 18.5 overs.

340.title: India's crude oil imports from Russia are minuscule: Petroleum Minister
340.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas, Hardeep Singh Puri, on Monday addressed the impact of Russia-Ukraine conflict on the import of crude oil and said that India's oil imports from Russia are "minuscule". He told the Rajya Sabha, "We require a total of 5 million barrels per day. That's our (crude oil) consumption...60% of it comes from the Gulf."

341.title: Chinese plane that crashed lost 26,000 feet in under 3 minutes, shows data
341.article_body: The China Eastern Airlines flight carrying 132 people, which crashed on Monday, was cruising at an altitude of 29,100 feet at 06:20:43 GMT, according to data from flight-tracking service Flightradar24. The Boeing 737 aircraft had descended to 9,150 feet at 6:21:40 GMT. At 6:22:35 GMT, the flight's altitude was 3,225 feet, according to Flightradar24.

342.title: He's like a family member: Pant on DC head coach Ponting
342.article_body: DC skipper Rishabh Pant said it's always special to meet head coach Ricky Ponting, adding it's like meeting a "family member". He added, "Whenever he comes to the field he brings that energy out of everyone. Everyone looks up to him like he's gonna say something different." Under Ponting, DC reached the IPL play-offs for third consecutive time last season.

343.title: Skeleton of 27-yr-old man found during ploughing of farmland in MP
343.article_body: A skeleton belonging to a 27-year-old man was found during the ploughing of sugarcane farmland in Madhya Pradesh's Narsinghpur district on Monday, police said. The deceased, Hemraj Kahar, went missing from his house on March 8, following which a complaint was filed by his wife. According to police, it appears to be a prima facie case of murder.

344.title: I'm trapped in beard, long hair over continuity of projects: Anil George
344.article_body: Actor Anil George has stated that he is trapped in his look of beard and long hair due to a continuity of projects, adding that he wants to experiment. "Makers want me in such looks and audience too loves it," he added. The actor further said that he had to forgo an Abbas-Mustan film due to the look.

345.title: Ajay a lavish producer, he made ₹32cr film in times of ₹8-10cr budget: Rohit
345.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty has called actor-producer Ajay Devgn a lavish producer, adding that he made 2000 film 'Raju Chacha' with a budget of ₹32 crore when normal budgets were ₹8-10 crore. "He is technically one of the most sound persons in the industry...['Runway 34] has another kind of visuals," the filmmaker added. Ajay has directed and stars in the film.

346.title: I will only help those who voted for me: UP BJP MLA Dinesh Rawat
346.article_body: BJP MLA Dinesh Rawat, who won from Uttar Pradesh's Haidergarh constituency, said, "These people should not come to me for any kind of help. I will help only those who have voted for me." Rawat said this while addressing a gathering on Holi and it came to light when a video of the event surfaced online.

347.title: US-based CommerceIQ turns unicorn with $115 million funding
347.article_body: Retail e-commerce management platform CommerceIQ has closed a $115 million Series D funding round at a valuation of over $1 billion, achieving unicorn status. The round was led by SoftBank Vision Fund 2 and included participation from Insight Partners, Trinity Ventures, Shasta Ventures and Madrona Venture Group.
