Based in California, US, CommerceIQ also has offices in Seattle and Bengaluru.

348.title: 125-year-old Swami Sivananda kneels before PM while receiving Padma Shri
348.article_body: UP-based yoga guru Swami Sivananda knelt before PM Narendra Modi even as the latter bowed before him with folded hands during the Padma awards ceremony on Monday. A video of 125-year-old Sivananda receiving the Padma Shri has been released by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting. Sivananda also knelt before President Ram Nath Kovind before receiving the honour.

349.title: Russian court bans Facebook and Instagram, classifies Meta as 'extremist'
349.article_body: A Russian court on Monday banned Facebook and Instagram in the country after classifying their parent company Meta Platforms as an "extremist" organisation. The ban does not include WhatsApp, Russia's TASS news agency reported. Russia had earlier blocked access to Instagram after Meta said it would allow Ukrainian users to post messages urging violence against Russian President Vladimir Putin.

350.title: Danish Siddiqui's parents to take legal action against Taliban over his death
350.article_body: Parents of photojournalist Danish Siddiqui, who was killed in Afghanistan last year during an assignment, will initiate legal action and move the International Criminal Court against the Taliban over Danish's death. Siddiqui was covering clashes between Afghan troops and the Taliban. "Danish was illegally detained, tortured and killed by the Taliban," said his family in a statement.

351.title: Putin must not win war in Ukraine: Estonian PM Kaja Kallas
351.article_body: Condemning the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Estonian PM Kaja Kallas has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "must not win this war". Kallas, who termed Russia's actions "heartbreaking", stated that NATO countries are doing all they can to support Ukraine. Kallas added that NATO's strategy should focus on ending war by moving from a "deterrence posture" to a "defence posture".

352.title: Germany, United Arab Emirates sign climate-friendly energy deals
352.article_body: German Minister of Economics and Climate Protection Robert Habeck on Monday said German firms signed five agreements related to hydrogen research and development with companies from the United Arab Emirates (UAE). As per the ministry, German firms, Abu Dhabi National Oil Company and Japan's JERA will undertake a joint demonstration project for hydrogen transport.

353.title: ASEAN's special envoy begins trip to Myanmar, meets junta chief
353.article_body: A special envoy from ASEAN, Prak Sokhonn, met with Myanmar's junta chief Min Aung Hlaing on Monday during his mission to facilitate the start of a dialogue between the military and opponents of its coup. Prak and Hlaing discussed "the situation of protests and violence stemming from political disagreement", an official statement said. The envoy's visit will end on Wednesday.

354.title: Most Russian forces remain over 25 kilometres from centre of Kyiv: UK
354.article_body: UK Ministry of Defence on Monday said bulk of Russian forces remain more than 25 kilometres from centre of Ukrainian capital Kyiv. "Heavy fighting continues north of Kyiv," stated military intelligence update from the ministry. The ministry added that Kyiv remains Russia's primary military objective and they are likely to prioritise attempting to encircle the city over the coming weeks.

355.title: Late CDS Gen Bipin Rawat awarded Padma Vibhushan, his daughters receive honour
355.article_body: India's first Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Bipin Rawat, who died in a helicopter crash in December 2021, was awarded the Padma Vibhushan posthumously on Monday. His daughters Kritika and Tarini received the award from President Ram Nath Kovind on their father's behalf. General Rawat's wife and 12 others were also killed in the same crash.

356.title: Preparing for most exciting role of my life: Anil as Sonam announces pregnancy
356.article_body: After actress Sonam Kapoor shared pictures from her maternity shoot as a way of announcing her pregnancy, her father Anil Kapoor tweeted, "Now preparing for the most exciting role of my life- Grandfather!" He added, "Our lives will never be the same again...I couldn't be more grateful! Sonam, Anand you've made us happy beyond measure with this incredible news."

357.title: Shahid Afridi is my favourite player, after that Shaheen: Nida Dar
357.article_body: Pakistan Women all-rounder Nida Dar said Shahid Afridi and Shaheen Shah Afridi are her top two favourite players. "So I celebrate like them," she added. Nida registered 4/10 to help her side claim their first win in ongoing Women's World Cup after defeating West Indies. Notably, Nida is the first Pakistani cricketer, male or female, to bag 100 T20I wickets.

358.title: Not invited to Oscars: Best Picture nominee West Side Story's Rachel Zegler
358.article_body: Actress Rachel Zegler, who is the lead actress of Oscar's Best Picture nominee 'West Side Story', has revealed that she has not been invited to the ceremony. She had responded to a fan's comment about her outfit at the ceremony. A fan commented, "So not fair," while another wrote, "How’s the leading actress of a movie....up for seven...awards not invited?"

359.title: PhonePe acquires Pune-based micro-entrepreneur platform GigIndia
359.article_body: Walmart-owned PhonePe on Monday announced that it has acquired Pune-based GigIndia, a network for freelance micro-entrepreneurs. PhonePe did not reveal the financial details of the deal. As part of the acquisition, GigIndia will be integrated with the digital payments platform. GigIndia has 1.5 million entrepreneurs and over 100 enterprises as customers, the company said in its press release.

360.title: No fears of 'stagflation' in India: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das
360.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "With regard to the prospect of stagflation, whether it is a risk for India, in our assessment I think such prospects don't exist." He added, "India is far away from such a grim prospect." 'Stagflation' is when there's slow economic growth and relatively high unemployment, which is at the same time accompanied by rising prices.

361.title: UP among 3 poorest states as per NITI Aayog’s ranking: Akhilesh
361.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said under the BJP government, Uttar Pradesh is among the three poorest states in India as per NITI Aayog's multidimensional poverty index. "[UP] ranks third in terms of malnutrition rate," Yadav said. Adding that UP ranks last in the child and adolescent mortality rate category, he said, "These are the badges of failure of BJP government."

362.title: Indonesia ends quarantine requirement for international arrivals
362.article_body: Indonesia has removed its quarantine requirement for all international arrivals, Indonesian Tourism Minister Sandiaga Uno announced on Monday. The decision comes after a quarantine waiver for vaccinated visitors to the islands of Bali, Batam, and Bintan was implemented earlier this month. A negative RT-PCR test will still be required to enter the country, Uno added.

363.title: Andrew reacts to 'No Way Home' not getting Oscar best film nomination
363.article_body: After 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' did not receive an Oscar nomination in the Best Picture category, actor Andrew Garfield has said that he's "pretty satisfied" with the audience's response to the film. "I mean, it's the sixth biggest movie in the history of movies...I think that's plenty," he added. The film received an Oscar nomination in the Visual Effects category.

364.title: Smokes from wildfires can destroy Earth's ozone layer: Study
364.article_body: Canadian study stated that smokes from wildfires can destroy Earth's ozone layer. In its observations on Australian wildfires, lead author Peter Bernath said fires injected acidic smoke particles into stratosphere which converted ozone-regulating compounds into more reactive compounds that destroy ozone. Team used data from Canadian Space Agency's Atmospheric Chemistry Experiment (ACE) satellite.

365.title: Hyd Police give clean chit to TRS leader's son in accident case
365.article_body: Hyderabad Police have given clean chit to Telangana Rashtra Samithi's (TRS) Bodhan MLA Mohammed Shakir Amir’s son Raheel Amir in an accident case, which killed an infant last Thursday. Raheel's 19-year-old cousin Syed Afnan Ahmed was driving the car which hit street vendors in Jubilee Hills, police said. Police also ruled out possibility of Afnan driving under influence of alcohol.

366.title: Pramod Sawant to continue as Goa Chief Minister for 2nd term
366.article_body: Goa's caretaker CM Pramod Sawant has been chosen as the CM of the state for a second term, days after BJP won 20 seats in the 40-member Goa assembly. Notably, this will be the third straight term of the BJP in Goa. Reports suggest that the swearing-in ceremony of the new government will tentatively take place between March 23-25.

367.title: 'Lagaan' inspired me to make a story on human emotions: Rajamouli
367.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli has revealed that he was inspired by Aamir Khan-starrer 2001 film 'Lagaan' to make a story based on basic human emotions. "The way the entire country connected with 'Lagaan' made a big impression on me," he added. Rajamouli further said 'Lagaan' was the first film to be accepted across India and it was only made in Hindi.

368.title: Archaeologists discover 4,000-year-old ancient tombs in Egypt
368.article_body: Egyptian Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities on Saturday announced that archaeologists discovered five 4,000-year-old ancient tombs in Saqqara sites southwest of Cairo. As per the ministry, the tombs contained artefacts dating back to the Old Kingdom, a period spanning roughly from around 2700 BC to 2200 BC. The officials added that tombs belonged to regional rulers and palace supervisors.

369.title: Rachakonda Police to provide free police recruitment training
369.article_body: The official Twitter handle of Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police shared that the Commissioner of Police is planning to provide free police recruitment training to the poor, middle-class unemployed persons. The post further said that it will help them work hard to get jobs. "Staff...instructed to exercise restraint to set up free coaching centers as soon as...notification was issued," it added.

370.title: Hyd Police urges people to report drugs supply, sale information
370.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Monday took to Twitter to urge people to share any type of information regarding the supply, sale, transportation or cultivation of marijuana and other narcotics. The force shared the appeal with the caption, "Bury the drugs or [they'll] bury you soon." The post said the identity of the person who reports the information would be kept confidential.

371.title: EU Foreign Ministers discuss sanctions against Russian oil, gas
371.article_body: EU Foreign Ministers on Monday discussed imposing sanctions on Russian oil and gas sector. While ministers of Lithuania and Ireland said EU must impose sanctions against the Russian energy sector, countries such as Germany, Netherlands which are heavily dependent on Russian gas warned against an embargo on Russian energy imports. Notably, EU relies on Russia for 40% of its gas.

372.title: China is considering $2.5 bn in financial aid for Sri Lanka: Envoy
372.article_body: Qi Zhenhong, the Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, on Monday said that China is considering a request for financial assistance from the South Asian nation. Sri Lanka has sought a $1 billion loan and a $1.5 billion credit line, he added. The request comes amid a severe economic crisis that has led to shortages of essential items in the country.

373.title: 'Race 1' was the best out of all films in the franchise: Bipasha
373.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu said that the 2008 film 'Race' was the best film of the franchise. "It was an amazing thriller and Abbas-Mustan directing the film made it even better because they are excellent with thrillers," she added. This comes as the film completed 14 years of its release on Monday. "The energy on the sets was palpable," Bipasha stated.

374.title: After PMC & PCMC, Pune Zilla Parishad to come under state govt
374.article_body: After Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC), Pune Zilla Parishad will now come under the state government, as the tenure of the elected members ended on Sunday. "The tenure of the elected members ended on Sunday and now the state government would be in charge of the policy decisions," said Zilla Parishad CEO Ayush Prasad.

375.title: Pune man kills 24-yr-old wife for not bearing child, arrested
375.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a 30-year-old man who allegedly strangulated his 24-year-old wife to death for not bearing a child. The incident took place at the Vetalnagar area of Ambegaon Budruk on March 18. Police said the accused Devanand Kalel told them that his wife Kajal had died by suicide, however, the post-mortem revealed that it was murder.

376.title: Deeply shocked & saddened: PM after Chinese plane with 132 people crashes
376.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday took to Twitter after a Chinese plane with 132 passengers crashed into the mountains on Monday. He wrote, "Deeply shocked and saddened to learn about the crash of the passenger flight MU5735 with 132 on board in China’s Guangxi. Our thoughts and prayers are with the victims of the crash and their family members."

377.title: Chinese flight lost altitude very fast, descended steeply on vertical trajectory
377.article_body: The China Eastern Airlines flight carrying 132 people, that crashed in a mountainous area near the city of Wuzhou on Monday, lost altitude very fast, according to real-time flight tracking service Flightradar24. Radar tracking also showed that the Boeing 737 plane descended steeply on an almost vertical trajectory. The flight was travelling from Kunming to Guangzhou.

378.title: 20-yr-old Swiatek wins her 5th women's singles title, becomes world no. 2
378.article_body: Poland's Iga Swiatek defeated Greece's Maria Sakkari in straight sets to clinch the women's singles title at the Indian Wells on Sunday. With this win, the 20-year-old champion secured her fifth career title and moved up to the second spot in the world rankings. "It's pretty crazy because I wasn't expecting to be in...final," Swiatek said.

379.title: Pune’s St Mira’s College holds TEDx with theme ‘Magic of Risks’
379.article_body: Pune's St Mira's College for Girls hosted the third edition of TEDx after a long COVID-19 break. The theme for the event, which was organised by Sarah Kinariwala, mentored by Professor Abhradita Chatterjee Nahvi and supported by Principal In-charge Dr Jaya Rajagopalan, CWE co-ordinator Dr Rama Venkatachalam and Team CWE, was "Magic of Risks."

380.title: Venkatesh is a team man, always talks about winning: KKR skipper Shreyas
380.article_body: Praising Venkatesh Iyer, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said the batter is a team man and always talks about winning. "That's the type of character we need in our team, one who is ready to go out there...show that relentlessness," he added. Talking about Venkatesh's batting spot in the team, Shreyas said that he's very flexible at any position.

381.title: If I'm home, nobody asks why I'm not at work: Shefali Shah on sexism
381.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has revealed that if she is at home and hasn't gone to work, nobody asks her why she hasn't gone. "But...I...ask [my husband filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah], 'Why are you not going to office today?'" she added. The actress further said that it has been years of conditioning that women stay home and husbands go to work.

382.title: Mumbai builder booked for continuing construction work after 10 pm
382.article_body: Mumbai-based Mahavir Developers has been reportedly booked for continuing construction work after 10 pm in violation of noise pollution norms. This comes after Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey issued strict noise pollution guidelines to infrastructure firms. According to guidelines, Bombay High Court orders are to be followed, including carrying out construction work only between 6 am to 10 pm.

383.title: Channi meets Punjab CM Mann in 1st meeting since Assembly polls
383.article_body: Former Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi met and congratulated the state's new CM Bhagwant Mann in Chandigarh on Monday. This is Channi's first meeting with CM Bhagwant Mann after the Assembly election results were announced on March 10. Channi lost the elections from both Assembly seats of Bhadaur and Chamkaur Sahib, where he had contested from.

384.title: Sanctions on Russia are like weapons of mass destruction: Raghuram Rajan
384.article_body: Sanctions imposed on Russia in the wake of the Russia-Ukraine war are like "weapons of mass destruction", former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said. "They may not topple buildings or collapse bridges but they destroy firms, financial institutions, livelihoods, and even lives," Rajan said. If not governed properly, sanctions could disturb the global financial order, he added.

385.title: Admission to DU's minority colleges might be based on CUET scores
385.article_body: Admissions to Delhi University's minority colleges, including St. Stephen's College and Jesus and Mary College, among others, could be based on the Common University Entrance Test (CUET) scores from the next academic year. Around 50% of the seats in various courses offered by minority colleges are reserved for students belonging to specific minority communities.

386.title: Glad to be part of new IPL team, build it from scratch: KL Rahul on LSG
386.article_body: KL Rahul, who will be leading Lucknow Super Giants in upcoming IPL after moving from Punjab Kings, said he's glad to be part of a new franchise and build it from scratch. "I have never sat in meetings discussing each and every player, how we want to set up the franchise...there is so much that has happened," he added.

387.title: 3 men stab man in neck in Gurugram after meeting him to end dispute
387.article_body: The Gurugram Police have booked three people for allegedly slitting the throat of a friend after a meeting to end an old dispute went wrong on Holi. According to the victim, he met the accused on Holi to resolve an old dispute. However, they had an argument again, following which Naresh (accused) stabbed him in the neck.

388.title: I'll be stupid not to do web series, finalising debut project: Daisy
388.article_body: Actress Daisy Shah has stated that the webspace has boomed amazingly, adding that she will be "really stupid" not to be open to doing a web series. "I've got a few offers. I'm still finalising on what I'll make my debut with," the actress said. Daisy added that web series have opened up a lot of job opportunities for everyone.

389.title: You've shown remarkable grit: PM Modi to Lakshya on All England silver
389.article_body: Following Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen's runner-up finish at 2022 All England Championships, PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter and wrote, "Proud of you Lakshya! You've shown remarkable grit and tenacity. He added, "You put up a spirited fight...I'm confident you'll keep scaling new heights of success." Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "There're no failures in life. You either win or you learn,"

390.title: Manipur CM lists govt's 3 priorities after taking oath for 2nd term
390.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Monday listed his government's three priorities after taking oath for his second consecutive term as Chief Minister. He said his government's "primary duty [is to] wash out corruption from the state". He added that his second and third priorities are to "wash out any kind of drug-related matter" and bring "insurgents...to the negotiating table".

391.title: Great Barrier Reef suffers bleaching due to ocean warming: Report
391.article_body: Climate Council, an Australian environmental group on Monday said the Great Barrier Reef is at risk of bleaching as ocean temperatures have increased by two to four degrees Celsius above average. Report added that the reef has suffered three mass bleaching events in past six years. This comes as a UN team is due to assess reef's World Heritage listing.

392.title: Deep-sea pipeline in Maharashtra's Palghar to be ready in 2 months
392.article_body: A deep-sea pipeline at Tarapur MIDC, being constructed to carry treated industrial effluents about 7 km away from high-tide line at Navapur beach in Maharashtra's Palghar district, will be operational within next two months, according to officials. The existing concrete pipeline that is operational since 1970s, suffers from frequent leaks, a Tarapur Environment Protection Society official said.

393.title: B'luru Traffic Police educates 2-wheeler riders about helmets
393.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Monday educated two-wheeler riders about wearing high-quality helmets. Pictures shared by the force show officers holding helmets and talking to the riders, while some riders posed with helmets provided by officers. The force also posted a video to raise awareness about helmets wherein it said that motorbike riders should wear a helmet bearing the ISI mark.

394.title: China Eastern Airlines' site turns black & white after crash as sign of respect
394.article_body: After the crash of its plane carrying 132 passengers, the website of  China Eastern Airlines turned black and white, a step airlines take in response to a crash as a sign of respect for the victims. The 737-800 aircraft crashed in southwest China on Monday, leading to a mountain fire while the number of casualties remain unknown.

395.title: Punjab Vidhan Sabha proceedings will now be telecast live: CM Mann
395.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Monday said proceedings of the state's Vidhan Sabha will now be telecast live. In his maiden address after Kultar Singh Sandhwan's unanimous election as the Vidhan Sabha Speaker, Mann said, "From now on, nobody will need to make a video without permission and face Privilege proceedings. The media will also get audio and videos."

396.title: Russian shelling kills at least 8 in Kyiv's Podil district: Report
396.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General on Monday said at least eight were killed on Sunday in Kyiv's Podil district due to shelling by Russian forces. As per Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko, several homes and a shopping mall were hit too. Meanwhile, UN said at least 902 civilians were killed and 1,459 others were injured in Ukraine from February 24 to March 19.

397.title: 13 NATO warships headed to Sweden amid bloc's drills in Norway: Report
397.article_body: As many as 13 warships from several NATO member countries were headed to Sweden's Frihamnen Port on Sunday amid bloc's "Cold Response 2022" military drills in Norway, Swedish media reported. The warships reportedly include nine German vessels. While the drills are being conducted amid Russia-Ukraine tensions, it was planned months prior and isn't related to the invasion, NATO has said.

398.title: China reports 2,027 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
398.article_body: Chinese authorities said the country reported 2,027 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday, up from 1,737 from the previous day. As per China's National Health Commission, out of 2,027 cases, 1,947 were locally transmitted infections and 80 were imported ones. The authorities added that Jilin province recorded the highest number of infections with 1,542 cases.

399.title: Scientists find new form of ice that may be found on distant planets
399.article_body: US researchers discovered a new form of ice that may be found on moons and water-rich planets outside our solar system. The team squeezed the water sample between the tips of two diamonds and further subjected the resulting ice crystals to laser heating. Scientists observed the gradual transition from water to ice due to pressure raising and laser heating.

400.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami named as Uttarakhand CM
400.article_body: Uttarakhand's caretaker CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has been chosen as the new state CM after BJP won 47 seats in the 70-member Assembly in the recently-concluded elections. Dhami had lost the Khatima seat to Congress candidate Bhuwan Chandra Kapri, who won by a margin of over 6,500 votes. Dhami had earlier taken charge as CM in July 2021.

401.title: Spain welcomed 25,000 Ukrainian refugees so far: Migration Minister
401.article_body: Spanish Migration Minister José Luis Escrivá on Monday said that about 25,000 Ukrainian refugees have arrived in Spain since Russia launched its invasion on February 24. Around 9,000 of them have registered themselves with the Spanish authorities, he added. Many of the Ukrainians who have arrived are staying with relatives or friends, Escrivá further said.

402.title: I'm at fault: Real Madrid manager Ancelotti after 4-0 loss vs Barca
402.article_body: Following a 4-0 loss against Barcelona, Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti said that his side was unrecognisable during the match and added everything went wrong for them. "We have to forget...and move forward, we have a big lead [in La Liga]. I...am at fault," he stated. Despite the loss, Real Madrid are on top of the La Liga points table.
